If you want to party at Eurosonic, then this is most definitely the one.

Teaching yourself to play guitar at age 14 by learning to play Radiohead's OK Computer is not a bad start for any musician. But growing up in the middle of Norway Koen van de Wardt didn't have much choice. At college he did, but yearning for the lonely creative days, he created Klangstof and uploaded Hostage to Soundcloud. The emotionally charged single was picked up by a label from LA and Klangstof set out to write about the unfamiliar. Epic soundscapes and guitars recall the quiet and fascinating Scandinavian landscape, while synthesisers and drum-machines add an industrial feel.

At just 19 years old Charlotte Brimner has already experienced some major career boosts. She was invited to SXSW twice and played Scotland's biggest pop festival T In The Park. The second single of her group Be Charlotte went straight into the Spotify Viral Top 50. Machines That Breathe is a catchy indie electro-pop song that has 'hit' and 'great future' written all over it. Keep an eye on this talented Scottish multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter, who has been dubbed "The most exciting emerging artist in ages" by BBC Radio 1.

You can count on Belgium to come up with the next big thing in many a genre. Mustii is another new gem, you can bet on him becoming pretty huge in electronic pop. The young man from Brussels was actually trained as a professional actor and has worked as a writer, composer, singer and stage director. Good thing he chose to pursue his love for 80ies synth pop and new wave, fusing it into his very own blend of theatrical electro pop. Next February his first EP will be released including the singles Feed Me and The Golden Age.

Rob Dekay left school at 15 to pursue his love of music. In 2010 his route took a serious turn when he ran into hiphop crew FATA. Four years later he supported rapper Akwasi on his solo tour and in 2015 he and Dio created the song Leuke Meisjes. In the meantime Rob worked on his solo career. He played multiple festivals and Top Notch released his debut EP filled with wayward soulful country pop.

Orange Skyline's rapid ascend in the Dutch industry is one out of the books. Performing over 40 festivals in one year such as Concert at Sea and Eurosonic/Noorderslag. Supporting Kensington at sold out Ziggo Dome shows. Having high rotation on 3FM radio, De Wereld Draait Door and being nominated for an Edison award is all quite an achievement if you know that Orange Skyline's debutalbum has yet to be released.
'Things That I Hide' will be released on January 13th and is co-produced by Kraak & Smaak's Oscar de Jong. Their first single 'Sound & Fury' is a good tastemaker of things to come for this Groningen based indie-pop band.

One of the coolest names this Eurosonic and, of course, Swedish Death Candy isn't even from Scandinavia. The experimental psych rockers are in fact an eclectic group of world travellers from London, Seoul and Bari, Italy. The four-piece formed in 2014 and quickly managed to attract the attention of music fans, peers and industry alike through the release of a early demo EP - coupled with a ferociously loud live show. Hassle Records released their debut EP Liquorice mid 2016.

Hawkwind-worshipping, Stooges-referencing soulful psychedelic rock'n'roll miscreants from Death Alley from Amsterdam deliver a live show that is a righteous next step for classic heavy rock, as punk as it is metal and delivered with nigh-on-unmatched vitality, screaming sex and panache. Soul brothers Motörhead and the whole gamut of speedrock can rest easy, Death's Alley will uphold their heritage. Volhouwe!

Donnerwetter plays psychedelic roots music with the menace of punk. The Dutch quartet navigates between danceable film music , the grooving primal urge of garage bands and dark romantic moods. It is clearly not death but life itself snapping at their heels. Always searching for the thrill of the Donnerwetter Dopamine! The intense live shows sound as if Wilco, MGMT, White Denim, The Cramps and Grizzly Bear together climbed on stage and captured Nick Cave as a ravishing front man.
PlatoMania: "Their kaleidoscopic rock hypnotizes, seduces and confuses." VPRO/3voor12: "Front man Rocco sings straight from the heart. You hear it, you feel it, you see it. Ballsy melancholy."

The Kik is a Dutch beat band inspired by sixties icons like The Beatles and The Kinks. The group is a gathering of former members of The Madd, Mark & The Spies and The Spades. The wayward dry, humorous frontman Dave von Raven is flanked by Arjan Spies (vocals/guitar), Paul Zoontjens (keys), Marcel Groenewegen (bass) and drummer Ries Doms. Their new album should arrive just in time for Noorderslag.

It's a long name, but one that fits like a glove. The Jerry Hormone Ego Trip is indeed the solo project of Jerry Hormone, once the guitarist for famed Rotterdam punk rockers The Apers, and a well known writer of children's books. This outfit is a different affair altogether, though. It is a Nederbeat (Dutch beat) rock 'n roll band with the best Dutch lyrics since The Kik. Nice ego trip Jerry! Their debut album Stout! Stout! Stout! (Naughty! Naughty! Naughty!) came out in November on the Excelsior label.

Short and fast fuzzy garage and noise rock from Amsterdam who specialise in catchy songs with loud guitars. After an EP in 2014, BARTEK followed up in September 2016 with the excellent Beach EP, led by the unpolished title song. They played a series of adrenaline drenched shows that carry the spirit of FIDLAR, Wavves and Ty Segall and a 'we don't give a fuck' attitude. They plan to release their first album in 2017 and provide Noorderslag with a steaming show, stage diving maniacs and all that stuff.

RONDÉ arrived like a train. Having started as a school project in 2014, the band from Utrecht scored two huge pop hits and got picked up by Dutch national radio 3FM. They played all the major festivals, including Noorderslag 2015 but were forced to take a break when singer Rikki Borgelt needed vocal chord surgery. But they came back strongly in 2016 with more pop gems, a debut album and another spot at Noorderslag.

Julien Barbagallo from Toulouse is the drummer for Tame Impala and at the same time a fundamentally European, basically French songwriter. You can clearly hear that in every intro, verse and chorus of his songs. It results in great French pop, that contains elements of folk, prog rock and chanson. Last album Grand Chien (Big Dog) was released in October 2016 by Arista/Sony Music.

description: Batida apresenta: The Almost Perfect DJ
text:
It has been proven that the most appreciated skill on a DJ is to keep his arm raised as much as he can and that is usually corresponded with appreciation in the form of noise. The purpose of this performance is to evaluate the limit of appreciation achieved by this exercise. How much can we celebrate an upright arm? By repetition, over 60 minutes, the side effect may be a total disassociation between the gesture and any demonstration of affection from the audience.


*You may hear a big number of Unshazaamable tracks, mostly from own, unreleased and favorite productions. Some of them will empty the dancefloor and others will amaze you forever. Almost. At some point there won't be much for you to stare at so you can focus on music and eventually dance like there is nothing more important to do on a DJ set.

Raw electro and darkwave with a punk attitude from Sweden. Rein has the inflammatory and socially aware bite of Atari Teenage Riot and the appeal and expression of Die Antwoord. Coming from a Stockholm suburb Joanna Reinikainen has needed little time to establish herself as a great hope for the Swedish electro scene. Rein attracted attention early in 2016 with her debut EP, and her self produced new single "I Don't Get Anything but Shit from You" is mastered by legend Mike Marsh (known for his work for Justice, The Prodigy, Chemical Brothers and Depeche Mode).

Singer-songwriter URSINA was born and raised in a small Swiss mountain village, where her musical universe consisted of classical music and Romansch folk songs. She majored in jazz studies and is especially captivated by Scandinavian artists like Ane Brun, Efterklang, and Jose Gonzalez, releasing her debut EP when living in Denmark. Back in Switzerland, she started writing songs mixing northern influences with her Romansch folk roots and with subtle, finely crafted pop and a lucid voice. Praised as one of the most interesting upcoming Swiss artists, she will release her debut album this month.

Kevin begon met het schrijven van zijn eerste rapteksten in zijn lokale buurthuis. Zijn talent werd al snel opgemerkt door twee van de oprichters van Rotterdam Airlines. Onder de vleugels van Rotterdam Airlines bleef Kevin zich verder ontwikkelen en bracht meer nummers uit. In 2016 zet de rapper zichzelf op de kaart met zijn debuut single 'Op de block' Ft. Emms van Broederliefde. Ook heeft hij in december, later dat jaar zijn debuut EP 'Kleine Versnelling' uitgebracht. Na een dag stonden alle 9 nummers in de Spotify top 50 van Nederland en het project komt binnen op nummer 3 in de album top 100. Wacht maar tot Kevin een iets grotere versnelling maakt.

Back to the eighties, to the era of post-punk and new wave: synthesiser dominated but gloomy music venting industrial desperation from Manchester to West Berlin. Drangsal is true to the legacy of The Cure, Spandau Ballet, XTC and Morrissey, but with a more modern indie pop touch. And that eclectic mixture is working for the 23-year-old Berliner Max Gruber. He is storming the German speaking market with his emotional "Brachialpop" (Brute Pop) and furiously dramatic live shows.

With a deliberately deceptive name this group from Latvia comes to rock your house with dance beats. Bandmaster features one of the country's leading DJ/producers (Rudd), producer Andis Ansons and notorious Baltic battle rapper Vina. They throw in a lot of boiling analogue synths, electronic beats and some infectious tunes. Give Me A Taste is particularly hard to get out of your head.

Trashy garage pop rascals Lookapony are all about addictive songs with raw, laid back vocals and energetic melodies, a good old rock 'n' roll vibe and a major 'we don't give a fuck' attitude. The Eindhoven foursome have played well over a hundred shows and supported acts such as Cosmonauts, Audacity, Drenge and Parquet Courts. After releasing a single on a Burger Records compilation mixtape in 2015, they are planning to release their debut full-length recording early this year. Ha-Satan is produced by Raven Aartsen (Mozes & The Firstborn) and recorded by Roel Blommers from Pauw.

Is it still possible to create your own genre or niche in the year 2016? It certainly is, as MHD shows with his 'Afro Trap' movement. The young Frenchman has earned himself a huge following online (over 100 million views on his YouTube channel alone) and in the streets of France. His mixture of traditional African music with hiphop and trap is hyper contagious and sure to make  any crowd dance.

A celebration of grief, they call it. In any case Crying Boys Cafe is a remarkable band. This four-piece from Rotterdam combines musical happiness with an appreciation of the fragility of life. A bit like the gospel songs in the cotton fields, their songs are cheerful regardless of the situation of the singers. And Crying Boys Cafe present some old fashioned prisoner blues and exotic eighties pop with an indie twist. Their concert will be a ritual of mixed emotions, that much is sure.

Rotterdam Airlines is a young, independent hip hop record label, management agency and music publisher. Founded in 2009 by a group of friends with a shared passion who have raised eyebrows from the first release Kifesh by Sevn Alias. The record went Gold and the career of Sevn Alias has exploded. The rapidly growing label also hosts Jairzinho, Lil Saint, Chip Charlez, BKO, Johnny Sellah, FMG, YFG and Kevin. After decades of listening to American and English hip hop, Dutch hip hop is now dominating the charts and festivals and Rotterdam Airlines is at the forefront.

Indie rock five-piece HAUS are one of the brightest talents to come out of London. Five young guys playing energetic, alternative rock, catchy choruses, electronics and the passion of predecessors like TV on The Radio, Foals and Bloc Party. HAUS have already built up a sizeable fan-base thanks to singles Haze and Blinded, and they arrive at Eurosonic with strong recommendations from VICE alongside Huw Stephens and Phil Taggart from BBC Radio 1.

Here is a blend of shoegaze indie pop and the kind of post-punk that you'd normally expect from Britain, Manchester, and Creation Records to be more precise. This particular four-piece consists of two brothers and two of their high school friends from Denmark who sound as versatile and gifted as a young Primal Scream or Stone Roses, or rather: the big hope of the Copenhagen indie scene.

KOFFIE has its roots in Afrobeat, jazz and modern electronic music. The music also features  influences from Fela Kuti and James Brown to Red Hot Chilli Peppers, Flying Lotus and Miles Davis. The eight boys from Amsterdam turn this Afrofunk blend into a steaming and groove-filled show that has been praised for its combination of virtuosity, groove and energy. In February it's time for the release of KOFFIE's third album Huntu.

This creation of Irish duo Morgan MacIntyre and Gemma Doherty is hauntingly beautiful. Saint Sister draw from early Celtic harp traditions, 60s folk and electronic pop to create 'atmosfolk': a mix of soulful vocal harmonies, dreamy synths and electro-acoustic harp. Debut EP Madrid, was produced by Alex Ryan (Hozier), and the band played SXSW, Glastonbury, Electric Picnic, Reeperbahn and Latitude. Expect their highly anticipated debut album in 2017.

Soul from the land of Fado. But make no mistake: Marta Ren is a true soul diva and her Groovelvets are the real thing too. Marta has been at it since the mid-nineties, when she started developing that strong voice by singing in a ska/reggae band, a breakbeat outfit and then experimenting with sixties funk and soul. Now the singer from Porto has our own really tight band, allowing her to reveal her talent and her love for old-school soul and funk.

London raised artist/songwriter/producer was advised by Adele to attend the prestigious BRIT school in London (which Amy Winehouse attended as well). He became the first ever continental European to graduate. Altrego is currently recording his debut album with Jim Eliot (Ellie Goulding, Kylie Minogue etc.) in the Welsh countryside set to release in 2017. Expect popsongs with a grain of electronica and a pinch of funk.

Swedish musician Albin Lee Meldau is a modern songwriter who tells stories picked up at pubs and on street corners. His music features elements of Americana, Scandinavian storytelling, soul, and folk as well as influences ranging from Bob Marley's Kaya to Hendrix' Voodoo Child and Dylan's poetry. After debut single Lou Lou went viral, attracting almost 12 million plays on Spotify, Meldau released his Lovers EP in May 2016.

Vera Jonas Experiment from Budapest is about music from the soul for the soul and the feet. An amalgamation of traditional singer-songwriting and indie, jazz, experimental music, loops, soul, funk and sweet melodies. The latest album Tiger, now! was released in April, 2016. Since then the band has been on tour in Hungary, Romania and Slovakia, playing clubs and festivals.

Noiserv is the solo project of David Santos from Lisboa, an artist who is rapidly and firmly establishing himself in France and Germany. Think of poetic and ethereal, neo-classical songs that draw references to Yann Tiersen, Sigur Rós or Radiohead. Santos prefers to do everything himself: writing songs, making videos, recording, releasing and performing. A admirable, Prince-like level of self-sufficiency that has certainly already taken him very far.

IDLES are punk. IDLES are post-punk. IDLES are British, very British, with that typical upfront vocal delivery that recalls Sleaford Mods, with with the riotous nature that has characterised the best punk bands. With a driving rhythmic basis and lyrics that are both poetic and funny, they are one of the bands to watch out for, especially if you're looking for a totally wild live show at Eurosonic.

description: MICHELLE DAVID & THE GOSPEL SESSIONS  EXTRAVAGANZA
text: Onno Smit and Paul Willemsen discovered Michelle David when looking for a vocalist for Lefties Soul Connection. Then the tables turned and for some years it has been all about the incredible soulful voice of the American gospel queen. The Gospel Sessions Vol. 1 was an introduction to the project, going back to the origins and essence of gospel while adding a new, minimal approach. The rougher yet vulnerable Volume 2 erased all that you thought you knew about the genre and conquered all the festivals. Up next: The Gospel Sessions Vol. 3.

They're young, funny and perky, and definitely an internet sensation. It might seem like three guys having good fun, joking around with 'Yung' hiphop names and singing mainly about drugs, sex and afterparties. But just like the title of their album (Free Wifi), it's spot on. It is what going out and life in general seem to be about for a whole generation of kids who feel like Yung Internet delivers the laid back hiphop soundtrack of their lives.

Mario Batkovic is an accordionist who says he isn't interested in genres. He isn't that easy to classify either. What we can say is that he learned to play in Bosnia and now operates from Switzerland as a composer and songwriter for various projects. His music is (contemporary) classical and influenced by jazz, minimalism, Balkan sounds with an experimental edge. He also works closely with Geoff Barrow (of Portishead fame), has just released his solo album on Bristol based record label Invada Records and performed at the prestigious ATP, Montreux Jazz and Le Guess Who? Festivals.

With a voice that has the soul of blues and the gravelly tones of Tom Waits, young Fil Bo Riva strikes you immediately. The 23-year-old is what you could call a 'true European'. He is half-Italian, hailing from Rome, grew up in Ireland and took off to Berlin, where he learned his craft busking in the streets. There Filippo Bonamici, the voice behind Fil Bo Riva, met like-minded guitarist Felix A.Remm and producer Robert Stephenson (Mighty Oaks). PIAS released their debut EP If You're Right, It's Alright in September, 2016.

Brass Rave Unit delivers high octane muscle and lung powered raves at any location and at any time. They gained notoriety by playing in the Amsterdam club scene, toppling over the DJ-stand and playing with all their might to remind people that live music and real instruments are still the best ingredients for an all-out party.

Influences include Björk, PJ Harvey and Moderat, making her "one of the most innovative minds in modern British Music", according to Pitchfork. Anna Meredith already had an established career in the classical world and had released two EPs, when the composer and producer released debut album Varmints on Moshi Moshi Records in March 2016 to even more critical acclaim. She performs with her band of classical musicians and a line-up of electronics, clarinet, cello, tuba, guitar and drums, and The Guardian awarded her live show with 5 stars, calling it "a triumph".

Remember Dry The River? Five guys from London with a hardcore background that started making folk? Well, they disbanded, but here is another five-piece with a similar background and a punk attitude plus some fine folk tunes featuring  rock guitars. Sam Alone doesn't need this introduction, nor do we need to mention that he (Poli Correia that is) hails from focus country Portugal. He and the Gravediggers have some great folky rock songs for you, delivered with charm and a raucous Springsteen like voice that sure sound Tougher Than Leather.

Meandering between folk, straightforward songwriter material and post-rock, Albert af Ekenstram is a special artist. In his solo work the Swede creates filmish melancholic music, enriched with grandiose arrangements, heartfelt voice and poignant lyricism. The power of Albert is to sound grand and intimate at the same time. His debut album Ashes came out in October on Kning Disk, drummer/keyboardist Filip Leyman took care of production like he did on Anna von Hausswolff's two latest albums.

This creation of Irish duo Morgan MacIntyre and Gemma Doherty is hauntingly beautiful. Saint Sister draw from early Celtic harp traditions, 60s folk and electronic pop to create 'atmosfolk': a mix of soulful vocal harmonies, dreamy synths and electro-acoustic harp. Debut EP Madrid, was produced by Alex Ryan (Hozier), and the band played SXSW, Glastonbury, Electric Picnic, Reeperbahn and Latitude. Expect their highly anticipated debut album in 2017.

Remarkable alternative rap from Tallinn, that is gaining street cred. Tommy Cash grew up in the Baltic ghetto in the midst of Russian art and pop music and first expressed himself through painting and dancing. His latest conquest is hip hop with Russian carpets, centaurs, green lasers and Adidas tights. His lyrics and videos are hilarious, but at the same time his sound is not to be taken lightly. It's hyper infectious and it's been raining 'Euroz Dollarz Yeniz' since the release of his debut album.

Folk from Brighton from a singer with a voice that reminds of Holly Golightly, Angel Olsen and Lana Del Rey. Bella Union was quick to sign the exciting talent that is Holly Macve and will release her first album in February. Singles No One Has The Answers and We Don't Know Where We Are Going show her exceptional gift for writing moving, rootsy songs that grip you with their dark undertone and themes. 20-year-old Holly Macve was named as one of their favourite artists at SXSW by The Guardian and NPR.

Indie rock five-piece HAUS are one of the brightest talents to come out of London. Five young guys playing energetic, alternative rock, catchy choruses, electronics and the passion of predecessors like TV on The Radio, Foals and Bloc Party. Call it indie disco pop or funk infused disco with nineties R&B, Ekkah sure have something that's catchy, smooth, funky, uplifting and sexy enough to fill up dance floors. London-based duo Rebecca Wilson and Rebekah Pennington released some brilliant tracks including the Last Chance To Dance EP and got strong airplay support from BBC Radio 1 and 6. They played Glastonbury twice and supported Kylie, Chic, Grace Jones and Take That in Hyde Park.

With a voice that has the soul of blues and the gravelly tones of Tom Waits, young Fil Bo Riva strikes you immediately. The 23-year-old is what you could call a 'true European'. He is half-Italian, hailing from Rome, grew up in Ireland and took off to Berlin, where he learned his craft busking in the streets. There Filippo Bonamici, the voice behind Fil Bo Riva, met like-minded guitarist Felix A.Remm and producer Robert Stephenson (Mighty Oaks). PIAS released their debut EP If You're Right, It's Alright in September, 2016.

They're raw, emotional, obviously wounded and intense. Black Foxxes are a trio from Exeter, UK that produce a dynamic mix of raw noise, pure melody and utterly immersive vocal breaks, recalling Brian Molko and Biffy Clyro. Their 2016 debut album I'm Not Well is an aptly titled effort that won't leave you unscathed, and they promise their live shows will make a big impression.

With a name that could easily be German, English or French, a voice like a seasoned native English singer and soulful electronic pop that seems remarkably mature for Eurosonic entrance level, Joan Thiele is a mystery in many ways. Facts: Italian mother, Swiss father, grown up in Colombia, went to England after high school and she clearly likes AlunaGeorge, Ry x, Flume, Little Dragon and Lianne La Havas. Her impressive recent album with hits Save Me and Taxi Driver make her one of the must-see acts at Eurosonic.

Carpenter Brut is a phenomenon that draws its influences from 80s TV shows and B-movies loaded with synthesizers. The mysterious and discreet man behind the pentagon - or the Brutagram as his fans call it - evokes an encounter between Justice's beats and the universe of John Carpenter. His last single / video Turbo Killer went to well over one million streams on YouTube and Spotify, and Carpenter Brut supported Ghost's tour throughout the US, Russia and large parts of Europe with a live performance that is full of visual and musical uppercuts.

Two of Ukraineʼs most fashionable and culturally relevant performers founded Onuka in 2013: Eugene Filatov and Nata Zhizhchenko. On stage their group expands to seven musicians and many varied tools: antique wooden flutes (sopilki), a Ukrainian lute (bandura), trombones, drums, and keyboards. Everything is then filtered through cutting-edge technology.

The term Onuka means "granddaughter" in Ukrainian and pays directs immediate homage to Nataʼs grandfather, Oleksandr Shlionchyk. A recognized master craftsman, his skills are now evident in the stagecraft of a future generation. Nataʼs grandfather, in fact, was held in such regard that he restored a mandolin (or kobza) belong to Ukraineʼs national poet, Taras Shevchenko (1814-1861). It was important to keep memory audibly alive - and the same obligation remains today.

What we can say is that he learned to play in Bosnia and now operates from Switzerland as a composer and songwriter for various projects. Festivals.

Since then the band has been on tour in Hungary, Romania and Slovakia, playing clubs and festivals.

Referring first and foremost to the music of Wyvern Lingo, an Irish group that understands the power of vocal harmony and possesses three voices to put that to use. The trio doesn't shy away from pulsating electronics either or the use of guitars. The resulting infectious blend of R&B, alternative rock and pop sets them apart from pretty much anything in Ireland and most of  Europe as well.

One of the coolest names this Eurosonic and, of course, Swedish Death Candy isn't even from Scandinavia. The experimental psych rockers are in fact an eclectic group of world travellers from London, Seoul and Bari, Italy. Outer Edges is not just any album of Groningen drum 'n bass masters Noisia. "It's called Outer Edges because it's us exploring the outer edges of what Noisia, the three of us together, is. It's about the idea that all the songs are little islands that we take to their individual edge. They're all like expeditions to far sides. There's no real concessions - we haven't been super DJ-friendly or radio-friendly at all. We've done no collaborations and hardly any vocals on the album." - Martijn, Nik and Thijs.

A celebration of grief, they call it. In any case Crying Boys Cafe is a remarkable band. This four-piece from Rotterdam combines musical happiness with an appreciation of the fragility of life. A bit like the gospel songs in the cotton fields, their songs are cheerful regardless of the situation of the singers. And Crying Boys Cafe present some old fashioned prisoner blues and exotic eighties pop with an indie twist. Their concert will be a ritual of mixed emotions, that much is sure.
