After years of hard work, their album is finally coming and they're ready to show the world that these are not merely regular Djs but an extravaganza! If you want to party at Eurosonic, then this is most definitely the one.

Inspired by traditional Afro Caribbean music from Curaçao and European dance, and the likes of Buraka Som Sistema, Major Lazer and M.I.A., Kuenta i Tambú have created a new and very danceable sound, and it's full of dancehall energy. Their secret is the clever balance between electronic sound samples, singing and chanting, and the infectious rhythms played by ritual tambú drums.

One of the coolest names this Eurosonic and, of course, Swedish Death Candy isn't even from Scandinavia. The experimental psych rockers are in fact an eclectic group of world travellers from London, Seoul and Bari, Italy. The four-piece formed in 2014 and quickly managed to attract the attention of music fans, peers and industry alike through the release of a early demo EP - coupled with a ferociously loud live show. Hassle Records released their debut EP Liquorice mid 2016.

NEEV is a hard to pin down Portuguese artist, a self-taught multi-instrumentalist, writer, composer and singer who moves across many worlds. He scored a huge hit with electronic pop song Breathe (with Seeb) that gathered nearly 70 million plays on Spotify alone, while his solo work is instrument-based and rooted in rock and blues. However, most of the music that brought him to Reeperbahn and now Eurosonic is still unpublished.

With a voice that has the soul of blues and the gravelly tones of Tom Waits, young Fil Bo Riva strikes you immediately. The 23-year-old is what you could call a 'true European'. He is half-Italian, hailing from Rome, grew up in Ireland and took off to Berlin, where he learned his craft busking in the streets. There Filippo Bonamici, the voice behind Fil Bo Riva, met like-minded guitarist Felix A.Remm and producer Robert Stephenson (Mighty Oaks). PIAS released their debut EP If You're Right, It's Alright in September, 2016.

These five ladies hailing from Sweden are conquering the rock world with their twin attack sound. Pure driven classic hard rock, played with sheer enjoyment and rock 'n roll deep from their bones. "Combining the high voltage of AC/DC and Motörhead with charismatic performances and looks that kill, Thundermother are one of Stockholm's greatest exports since melodic death metal", says Revolver Magazine who picked Thundermother as 'Band To Watch' in their December issue.

An exciting Slovakian band that is making waves all over Europe. The Ills were voted into the 'Top 25 most exciting gigs at Iceland Airwaves Music Festival' by Consequence Of Sound, which is a big thing considering they make instrumental music. Not surprising though if you listen to their excellent album Ornamental Or Mental, showcasing well-constructed compositions that venture from post-rock to shoe-gaze, math and prog-rock and usually end in intense, gripping  crescendos.

Founder of the highly successful Portuguese group Madredeus, Rodrigo Leão combines pop melodies and classical arrangements, accompanied by a small ensemble. He has recorded with Beth Gibbons, Neil Hannon, Ryuichi Sakamoto and Ludovico Einaudi, and written film music for Wim Wenders and Oscar nominated The Butler. He also won praise from Pedro Almodóvar in Billboard Magazine; won many prizes and performed all over the world.

IDLES are punk. IDLES are post-punk. IDLES are British, very British, with that typical upfront vocal delivery that recalls Sleaford Mods, with with the riotous nature that has characterised the best punk bands. With a driving rhythmic basis and lyrics that are both poetic and funny, they are one of the bands to watch out for, especially if you're looking for a totally wild live show at Eurosonic.

"A stunning debut from possibly the most promising talent from Portugal since Cristiano Ronaldo," says David Welsh from musicOMH in Toronto. And he has a point; Best Youth is obviously crammed with talent. The music, reminiscent of The xx and Daughter, has a dreamy, lustful atmosphere and will surely take them on their chosen path further into Europe. Starting at Eurosonic.

Here is a blend of shoegaze indie pop and the kind of post-punk that you'd normally expect from Britain, Manchester, and Creation Records to be more precise. This particular four-piece consists of two brothers and two of their high school friends from Denmark who sound as versatile and gifted as a young Primal Scream or Stone Roses, or rather: the big hope of the Copenhagen indie scene.

Referring first and foremost to the music of Wyvern Lingo, an Irish group that understands the power of vocal harmony and possesses three voices to put that to use. The trio doesn't shy away from pulsating electronics either or the use of guitars. The resulting infectious blend of R&B, alternative rock and pop sets them apart from pretty much anything in Ireland and most of  Europe as well.

With a brash 'move over, here's Elle' attitude a fresh Scottish singer arrives at Eurosonic. Expect a show where electro rock meets pop and synths and guitars, all of that carried by the powerful voice and personality of Elle. Her first album Love Fuelled Hate is out on her own LX label, which, with its in your face production and hits like Lately and Sick it's easy to see the new British pop star the local media are predicting.

Irish singer-songwriter Lisa O'Neill produced an utterly beautiful and honest third album in 2016. After her witty debut Has An Album and the follow-up Same Cloth or Not marked her as a serious artist, Pothole in the Sky is the artistic leap that had to be taken. And she leapt with grace and conviction. Her record showcases her distinct voice and equally sharp word-play, revealing even the darkest corners of her mind.

Meet Gli Sportivi, two guys from Venice, Italy who sounding like a small army. They play 'Fuzz 'n Roll', or rather lo-fi garage blues with a creepy fuzz guitar and apocalyptic drums. Gli Sportivi use hand-made instruments like "The Stick of Death", a one stringed instrument that is supposed to sound like a chainsaw chopping the stage. Be warned: the duo has 'reached a destructive level'.

Julien Barbagallo from Toulouse is the drummer for Tame Impala and at the same time a fundamentally European, basically French songwriter. You can clearly hear that in every intro, verse and chorus of his songs. It results in great French pop, that contains elements of folk, prog rock and chanson. Last album Grand Chien (Big Dog) was released in October 2016 by Arista/Sony Music.

An unconventional electronic collective from Porto that travels deep into the exploration and experimentation of what a lab full of synthesisers and groove boxes can produce. The Portuguese trio mix tropical rhythms with industrial vocoders, as well as danceable grooves that produce profound hypnotic ambience. After an EP and a debut album they performed regularly in 2016, including festivals like Primavera Sound and SXSW in Texas, and they now feel completely at home on stage.

Throes + The Shine embody both adventure and vitality. They are in fact two bands that started out by mixing rock 'n roll (Throes from Porto) with Kuduro (The Shine from Luanda, Angola) and their fusion now spans genres and influences that are spread out through a multitude of cultures. The band use every ounce of their creativity to build an infectious steaming live show that combines the energy of Buraka Som Sistema and Skip & Die with the rhythmic madness of Meridian Brothers. It comes with a party guarantee.

Man Duo is the new project by Jaakko Eino Kalevi (Domino Records) and his long-time collaborator and friend Sami Toroi (aka Long-Sam). This is their second album, having worked together on 2013's 'Amateurs de Verite' LP, but this is the first incarnation of Man Duo. The duo, from Berlin and Helsinki, deliver rich electronic pop, sealed with the kind of quality and oddity fans have come to expect from Jaakko Eino Kalevi.

Mario Batkovic is an accordionist who says he isn't interested in genres. He isn't that easy to classify either. What we can say is that he learned to play in Bosnia and now operates from Switzerland as a composer and songwriter for various projects. His music is (contemporary) classical and influenced by jazz, minimalism, Balkan sounds with an experimental edge. He also works closely with Geoff Barrow (of Portishead fame), has just released his solo album on Bristol based record label Invada Records and performed at the prestigious ATP, Montreux Jazz and Le Guess Who? Festivals.

East of My Youth is an Icelandic duo (Thelma Marín Jónsdóttir & Herdís Stefánsdóttir) that plays melodic, electronic pop, likes both Grimes and Lana Del Rey and draws its influences from various genres and moods. The Nordic music platform Jajaja commented that listening to East Of My Youth  is "as sensual and addictive as getting your tongue frozen to a glacier of pure honey". Debut single Mother was followed by an equally seductive debut EP.

Swedish musician Albin Lee Meldau is a modern songwriter who tells stories picked up at pubs and on street corners. His music features elements of Americana, Scandinavian storytelling, soul, and folk as well as influences ranging from Bob Marley's Kaya to Hendrix' Voodoo Child and Dylan's poetry. After debut single Lou Lou went viral, attracting almost 12 million plays on Spotify, Meldau released his Lovers EP in May 2016.

Five youngsters from Amsterdam who met at the conservatory, and share a love for for psychedelic grooves from the 60s and 70s, preferably with out of tune organ sounds and guitar riffs. 'Psych, groove-'n-garage' is how The Mysterons describe their sound. The voice of Josephine van Schaik, often compared to Lou Rhodes (Lam) completes the catchy songs of this fine group. Their debut album is coming out on Excelsior Recordings in February.

A pulsating electronic drive and intimate dark tales meet in the music of BIRTHH. It's the project of 19-year-old Italian Alice Bisi, someone who is not afraid to uncover her injured soul: "This is how I want to die". Bisi's troubled lyrics get under the skin in the same way that PJ Harvey or Daughter can, and The xx would be proud of a song like Chlorine. Also try the impressive album Born In The Woods!

Meandering between folk, straightforward songwriter material and post-rock, Albert af Ekenstram is a special artist. In his solo work the Swede creates filmish melancholic music, enriched with grandiose arrangements, heartfelt voice and poignant lyricism. The power of Albert is to sound grand and intimate at the same time. His debut album Ashes came out in October on Kning Disk, drummer/keyboardist Filip Leyman took care of production like he did on Anna von Hausswolff's two latest albums.

Featuring pumping drums, mad breaks and free jazz. Elephant9 is a musical monster from Norway. Their blend of jazz, rock, prog and psychedelic (feel the organ) is purest and strongest when it is set free, allowing the band's dynamic and ever evolving moods to create spontaneous song structures. Influences range from Tangerine Dream, John Coltrane, Deep Purple, King Crimson and Jimi Hendrix to Soft Machine and Fela Kuti, and the third quarter of 2017 will see their highly anticipated new album released.

Referring first and foremost to the music of Wyvern Lingo, an Irish group that understands the power of vocal harmony and possesses three voices to put that to use. The trio doesn't shy away from pulsating electronics either or the use of guitars. The resulting infectious blend of R&B, alternative rock and pop sets them apart from pretty much anything in Ireland and most of  Europe as well.

This is medicinal music. Shaun Nunutzi, a member of the fearsome band Dead Skeletons, is now operating under the name TAU accompanied by Venezuelan multi-instrumentalist Gerald Pasqualin. The mystical powers of the desert lands of the Real de Catorce in North West Mexico form the inspiration for the deeply psychedelic mind-trip EP entitled Wirikuta. Immerse yourself via Bandcamp. The full-length recording TAU TAU TAU landed in September via Fuzz Club and provides more transcendental psychedelia.

Belgian performer Delv!s has a one-of-a-kind voice and revels in a mixture of pop, soul and blues. This exceptional voice saw him perform at major festivals in the Benelux. Delv!s signed with the Parisian label Because Music, and if the sexy, funky debut single Come My Way is any sign of what we can expect of his album...then Delvis really is a player.

He is following in the roch tradition of classic songwriters such as Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell and Neil Young, while touching on the soulful Michael Kiwanuka. Londoner L.A. Salami produces an energetic tumble of ideas and influences, mixing beat poetry, chain-gang blues, hip-hop and pithy one-liners. His debut album, Dancing With Bad Grammar, came out in August 2016 on Sunday Best/ [PIAS]/ Domino.

Hawkwind-worshipping, Stooges-referencing soulful psychedelic rock'n'roll miscreants from Death Alley from Amsterdam deliver a live show that is a righteous next step for classic heavy rock, as punk as it is metal and delivered with nigh-on-unmatched vitality, screaming sex and panache. Soul brothers Motörhead and the whole gamut of speedrock can rest easy, Death's Alley will uphold their heritage. Volhouwe!

Treading new musical ground, Deprez who co-fronts Belgian rock band Balthazar, has emerged from his home studio with an altogether different sound, a cornucopia of evocative synth beats drawn from a range of influences; be it his father's love of Kraftwerk or the pop sensibilities of his own musical discoveries, Calm Down is the first fruit of that journey.

Shorn of band vaguaries, J.Bernardt is there to stand on its own merits, existing in an altogether different locale, and seductive grooves enveloped in warm soulful vocals permeate throughout. Written and recorded at home in Ghent, multi-instrumentalist Deprez has seen the entire project evolve from experimenting with a synth, armed with a DIY aesthetic to a collection of tracks that will provide the basis for J.Bernardt's debut album, slated for release in 2017.

Moonshiners are a rythm & blues band from Aveiro, Portugal. The five young musicians are smugglers of emotions who deliver galvanising, soulful and rocking performances. Moonshiners launched their latest album Good News For The Girls Who Have No Sex-Appeal in 2015 with special guest The Legendary Tigerman.

Carpenter Brut is a phenomenon that draws its influences from 80s TV shows and B-movies loaded with synthesizers. The mysterious and discreet man behind the pentagon - or the Brutagram as his fans call it - evokes an encounter between Justice's beats and the universe of John Carpenter. His last single / video Turbo Killer went to well over one million streams on YouTube and Spotify, and Carpenter Brut supported Ghost's tour throughout the US, Russia and large parts of Europe with a live performance that is full of visual and musical uppercuts.

Is there such a thing as too many guitarists in a band? Finland's Teksti-TV 666 think not. Formed three years ago, things have escalated rather quickly for the seven-piece shoe-gazing kraut-punk monster. Armed with no less than five (at times six) electric guitars, Teksti-TV 666 are nowadays one of the most in-demand live acts in their native Finland, and select performances abroad have caused a storm as well. After a Finnish tour with Kvelertak in the autumn, the band will set their sights on Europe, beginning with a tour in Norway and then at Eurosonic.

"A stunning debut from possibly the most promising talent from Portugal since Cristiano Ronaldo," says David Welsh from musicOMH in Toronto. And he has a point; Best Youth is obviously crammed with talent. The music, reminiscent of The xx and Daughter, has a dreamy, lustful atmosphere and will surely take them on their chosen path further into Europe. Starting at Eurosonic.

First single Oweynagat and their show at the 2016 Roadburn festival were a clear warning sign to many: DOOL is a dark rock band to be reckoned with. The impressive live shows from this super-tight band formed by Rotterdam singer Ryanne van Dorst becomes a bit more understandable when you realise that most members were present in her last band Elle Bandita. It is dark, doomy, moving and at the same time accessible rock that begs you to dive in and submit. German label Prophecy Productions signed them up and will release their debut album in the same month as Eurosonic.

It's the kind of futuristic R&B and electronics blend that you expect from London or Berlin. And bonzai proves that you should expect that from Dublin as well. She adds a rawness, a punky, rave attitude that sets her apart. Hard to label, easy to love, and Zane Lowe and Annie Mac want you to check out her Sleepy Hungry EP. After a UK tour with Mura Masa the young Irish star supported Flume on a sold out European tour.

Dukat Stray and his five piece band Stray Dogg hail from Belgrade. They have released three albums full of rootsy indie rock and worked with the great Devendra Banhart on the latest one: 'Come Along Wind' from 2015. The Serbian group also performed live with Lisa Hannigan. Other influences include Neil Young and Jason Molina. Expect a new album in autumn 2017 and an intense performance at Eurosonic.

Noise pop performed solo by GIUNGLA , a.k.a. Emanuela Drei, Italian-born singer-songwriter based in Bologna. Giungla means 'jungle' in Italian. It refers to a rich environment with many and varied forms of life. In this sort of happy place, where there's no room for reason and control, Drei created minimal pop songs with an in-your-face attitude. Songs that hover between PJ Harvey, Grimes and The xx. So far there is only the Camo EP released in May 2016 to listen to, and the live show to look forward to.

Sassy garage pop and lo-fi songs from 'the most exciting new band from Berlin'. Gurr sounds like a trashy sixties girl group with poppy vocals and two voices with a flavour of eeriness 'dug out from the deep darkness that is the Berlin rock 'n' roll bar's restroom at 5am'.  Try their 2016 debut album In My Head for some great tunes, laidback garage and 'first wave gurrrlcore'.

This creation of Irish duo Morgan MacIntyre and Gemma Doherty is hauntingly beautiful. Saint Sister draw from early Celtic harp traditions, 60s folk and electronic pop to create 'atmosfolk': a mix of soulful vocal harmonies, dreamy synths and electro-acoustic harp. Debut EP Madrid, was produced by Alex Ryan (Hozier), and the band played SXSW, Glastonbury, Electric Picnic, Reeperbahn and Latitude. Expect their highly anticipated debut album in 2017.

Fran Palermo's music is like a kaleidoscopic mixture of colours: it constantly changes, re-forms itself, still, in all its elements, creates an exciting and spectacular unity. In their music they mix rock elements with special instruments like conga, synth, saxophone and trumpet. The speciality of the band comes not just from the mixing of the instruments, but from the diversity in the origin of its members. The guys are from different countries such as Cuba, Spain, Greece and Hungary.

Considering their age, they seem to be students rather than career academics, but, boy, when they grab their guitar, harmonica, bass and drums, they really go nuts and become virtuoso professors that will give you a lesson to remember! Good old rock'n'roll with young blood and spirit, taking the best from the heritage of blues, funk and psychedelic rock'n'roll and making their own explosive mixture to blow your ears and hearts away while your legs do funny things. The Professors have been one of the hardest working live bands in the past years, taking to the stages at all manner of clubs, bars, streets, venues and TV shows in Slovenia, Europe and now they are arround the States, playing in New York, St. Louis, Memphis, New Orleans, Austin Texas, Tucson Arizona, San Francisco, Berkley, San Jose, ... Each gig increased their word of mouth reputation and number of wacky fans that range from teenagers to the elderly.

Tender, fragile folk framed by beautiful, emotional and well crafted songs. The musical twins of Good Harvest need just two acoustic guitars and two microphones to captivate audiences with interweaved, harmonic folk. The Swedish duo reached 2 million streams with their cover of Joni Mitchell's Woodstock and 2017 will see them release their second EP.

Soul from the land of Fado. But make no mistake: Marta Ren is a true soul diva and her Groovelvets are the real thing too. Marta has been at it since the mid-nineties, when she started developing that strong voice by singing in a ska/reggae band, a breakbeat outfit and then experimenting with sixties funk and soul. Now the singer from Porto has our own really tight band, allowing her to reveal her talent and her love for old-school soul and funk.

Lion Kojo is one of the up-and-coming names of Amsterdam. The DJ and producer makes a diverse style, rooted in the broad spectrum he used to listen to as a young kid with big dreams: from Biggie, Madlib, UK Garage & Bass, Opgezwolle, Mighty Diamonds and Habib Koité to Sade, Hudson Mohawke and Grace Jones. He finished his music academy and earned residencies at Bassline (Paradiso, Amsterdam) and CHIPS (BAR, Rotterdam). Lion also showed his huge potential at big Dutch festivals like Lowlands and Down The Rabbit Hole.

Yung Nnelg is one of the most promising hip hop artists from Amsterdam. Having made a name for himself as a member of the SMIB collective as well as on mix tapes by contemporaries like Bokoesam, Nnelg got selected as Encore Freshmen by leading Dutch hip-hop organisation Encore. He scored an internet hit with Chamos and followed up in 2016 with the solid Fox P2 EP.

Indie rock five-piece HAUS are one of the brightest talents to come out of London. Five young guys playing energetic, alternative rock, catchy choruses, electronics and the passion of predecessors like TV on The Radio, Foals and Bloc Party. HAUS have already built up a sizeable fan-base thanks to singles Haze and Blinded, and they arrive at Eurosonic with strong recommendations from VICE alongside Huw Stephens and Phil Taggart from BBC Radio 1.

After first single T-Shirt van Metallica (about kids wearing band shirts without knowing the music) many people thought Fleddy Melculy was a prank. Next up were songs about what happens when they are out of bread or when they come to trash a party at your house. The songs and videos gained a lot of support and the metal band from Brussels does indeed sound pretty damn tight, the result of years acting as support group for famed Belgian entertainer Urbanus. Debut album Helgië makes it clear, that this is very funny and very serious metal to party to.

Four guys from Barcelona and Mallorca deliver  guitars soaked with shimmering chorus effects, driving bass lines, a touch of fuzz and high-speed tempos to create upbeat music with a surf vibe. On 2014's The Sea, Beach Beach mix 80's jangle pop with 90's indie rock and classic rock from the 70's. 2017 will see the Spaniards release their third album, which for sure will make hearts beat faster.

Mehdi Benjelloun started making waves as Petit Biscuit by posting tracks on SoundCloud there were composed and recorded in his bedroom. The French Nils Frahm fan was spotlighted by Les Inrockuptibles, who judged him to be "already winning thanks to a few tracks of golden sand, which evoke the soft and languid psychedelics of Flume as well as the tenacious melancholy of The xx". The track Sunset Lover has had more than 60 millions streams an counting. His music consists solely of sampled voices of his friends, filtered and modulated into instruments, and his first LP arrives June 2017.

Macedonian post-punkers that have, over the years, taken up a more electronic approach. Bernays Propaganda are actually post-punk activists and singer Kristina Gorovska vents their strong political views in their own language. They played over 400 shows all over Europe, Russia and US and released four full-length albums (on Moonlee Records) plus a split 7" with Mike Watt, which makes them one of the region's most successful young bands. Their music flirts with electronic new-wave, recalling the early 80s sound of New Order as well as German indie-tronic kings The Notwist.

Raw electro and darkwave with a punk attitude from Sweden. Rein has the inflammatory and socially aware bite of Atari Teenage Riot and the appeal and expression of Die Antwoord. Coming from a Stockholm suburb Joanna Reinikainen has needed little time to establish herself as a great hope for the Swedish electro scene. Rein attracted attention early in 2016 with her debut EP, and her self produced new single "I Don't Get Anything but Shit from You" is mastered by legend Mike Marsh (known for his work for Justice, The Prodigy, Chemical Brothers and Depeche Mode).

Sonars are a three piece from Brighton (UK) and Bergamo (IT) that deliver 'Astral-Pop'. In fact, you could also call it psychedelic pop and rock in the spirit of Flaming Lips, MGMT and Tame Impala, adding some sixties and seventies rock love. Sonars are English brothers Frederick and David Paysden on guitar and drums and Serena Oldrati on keyboards. They released a self-produced debut EP in 2015 and are currently working on their first album, due early 2017.

Betsy grew up on a goose farm in rural Wales, surrounded by music. She sings, writes and produces, making timeless music that will touch people now and for years to come. Think electronic pop with a classical and trip hop touch and apowerful voice somewhere between Aretha Franklin, Massive Attack and Grace Jones. Her all-female live band includes a violinist and a cellist. Debut EP Fair has swiftly surpassed 1.6 million plays on Spotify, topping the Spotify UK and US Viral Charts, and gaining support on Radio 1.

description: Mike Mago Presents: The Big Bad After
text: At night the freaks come out to play. There's a beast in man that should be exercised, not exorcised!

Remarkable alternative rap from Tallinn, that is gaining street cred. Tommy Cash grew up in the Baltic ghetto in the midst of Russian art and pop music and first expressed himself through painting and dancing. His latest conquest is hip hop with Russian carpets, centaurs, green lasers and Adidas tights. His lyrics and videos are hilarious, but at the same time his sound is not to be taken lightly. It's hyper infectious and it's been raining 'Euroz Dollarz Yeniz' since the release of his debut album.

Remember Dry The River? Five guys from London with a hardcore background that started making folk? Well, they disbanded, but here is another five-piece with a similar background and a punk attitude plus some fine folk tunes featuring  rock guitars. Sam Alone doesn't need this introduction, nor do we need to mention that he (Poli Correia that is) hails from focus country Portugal. He and the Gravediggers have some great folky rock songs for you, delivered with charm and a raucous Springsteen like voice that sure sound Tougher Than Leather.

London via Malmö group Francobollo claim to provide 'everything you ever wanted for Christmas, but were afraid to ask: head turning, eyebrow-raising, jaw-dropping, pant-shitting shows'. They sound like Weezer, Pavement and Grandaddy in a blender and became the first signing to producer Charlie Andrew's (Alt-J, Marika Hackman, Darwin Deez) new record label, and publishing company. Their next single Kinky Lola was premiered on DIY and Clash Magazine, and featured on Spotify's Fresh Finds playlist. The Wonderful EP followed in November.

Mozes and the Firstborn burst onto the scene as major garage rock talents. They toured the States three times, released tracks on Burger Records and Top Notch and then went quiet. Turned out the crew from Eindhoven needed to dump their intended second album to throw off their shackles and be resurrected. Their second coming brought about a glam pop appearance with similarly addictive songs. Suits them well. Don't trust them when they sing Nowhere Bound.

Dream pop, shoe-gaze and psych fans can rejoice over the coming of Baywaves. Here's a band from Madrid that knows how to craft pop songs with shiny melodies and marine reverb vibes. 'Hipnopop' is what the Spanish newcomers call their summery blend. Their debut EP Only For Uz is mixed by King Gizzard's guitar hero Joe Walker and has seen them perform at festivals such as FIB Benicàssim, Primavera Sound, Quintanilha Rock, End Of The Road and Eurosonic.

ME + MARIE are Maria de Val and Roland Scandella from Switzerland and Munich. Their folky indie rock is melancholic, untamed, sensitive and rough. They make their unity heard and felt with perfectly harmonising voices, drums and guitar. Their on-stage presence is as impressive as their songs, which are minimalistic but fill up the room up and paint a powerfully intimate soul portrait. Debut album One Eyed Love came out in May 2016.

Ala.ni has soul and lots of it. The songwriter from London and Paris, raised by Grenadian parents, opened many eyes and ears when she sang Cherry Blossom on Later With Jools Holland in late 2015. She bundled a series of EPs to create her first album You & I in June 2016. Her voice has such a melancholic and authentic sob that she could easily be mistaken for singers like Nina Simone and Nancy Sinatra. After playing major festivals in France and the UK it is now time to venture further into Europe.

RONDÉ arrived like a train. Having started as a school project in 2014, the band from Utrecht scored two huge pop hits and got picked up by Dutch national radio 3FM. They played all the major festivals, including Noorderslag 2015 but were forced to take a break when singer Rikki Borgelt needed vocal chord surgery. But they came back strongly in 2016 with more pop gems, a debut album and another spot at Noorderslag.

"View looks set to be the next breakout success from Finland", according to The Line of Best Fit. The 23-year-old is certainly the hottest up and coming rap artist from the Nordic country, thanks to his dark and hypnotic vocals mixed with icy beats that take you to previously unknown places. View's lyrics focus on introspection and personal issues, giving his music a rare and poignant honesty. His debut album is due to be released in spring 2017 via Cargo Cargo Records in Germany.

Harm Coolen and Merijn Scholte Albers dream up slow-burning, emotive and highly dynamic electronic music, usually with a touch of  danceable drama and some epic melodies. Weval's arrangements are so incredibly catchy and well-crafted that you'd suspect some seasoned veteran of being behind the decks instead of these Amsterdam youngsters. After the excellent Half Age EP on local label Atomnation, highly respected German label Kompakt acknowledged their extraordinary talent and released their first full length LP in mid-2016. Weval appeared at Eurosonic last year, but this time around they will play live at both Eurosonic and Noorderslag.

Hailed as one of the artists that changed the face of Dutch music and paved the way for hiphop acts to the charts, and festivals, and even the mainstream. Broederliefde is made up of five young guys from Rotterdam who started to attract attention by releasing tracks and mix tapes through social media. From first single Labanta to albums Hard Work Pays Off 1 and 2, they broke record after record. Their music is a sizzling mixture of hiphop and their roots from Cape Verde, Curaçao and the Dominican Republic, and it deals with everyday stuff like football, parties and women.

Brass Rave Unit delivers high octane muscle and lung powered raves at any location and at any time. They gained notoriety by playing in the Amsterdam club scene, toppling over the DJ-stand and playing with all their might to remind people that live music and real instruments are still the best ingredients for an all-out party.

She was the coming kid of Belgian hiphop in 2014, three years later Coely is back at Eurosonic as an established and complete artist. The 22-year old was born and raised in Antwerp and is proud of her Congolese heritage. She serves a blend of sunny and funky hiphop, spiced with heaps of soul, R&B and steamy raps. Basically,  Coely has the attitude, the talent and the catchy singles to win over a huge following. She has still only recorded one EP from 2013, but her latest single is the harbinger of an album that Universal will release in 2017.

Teaching yourself to play guitar at age 14 by learning to play Radiohead's OK Computer is not a bad start for any musician. But growing up in the middle of Norway Koen van de Wardt didn't have much choice. At college he did, but yearning for the lonely creative days, he created Klangstof and uploaded Hostage to Soundcloud. The emotionally charged single was picked up by a label from LA and Klangstof set out to write about the unfamiliar. Epic soundscapes and guitars recall the quiet and fascinating Scandinavian landscape, while synthesisers and drum-machines add an industrial feel.

Being included in Spotify's Spotlight Artist To Watch in 2016 list, you might think that it's no wonder that LÉON generated so many millions of streams. Then you realise that the likes of VEVO, Buzzfeed and Snapchat also tipped the Swedish singer and that her EP and singles Think About You and Tired Of Talking have precisely what it takes. Perfectly crafted pop songs delivered with a specially soulful voice, that gives away her musical upbringing. You could also say the decision to work with producer Agrin payed off.

This is medicinal music. Shaun Nunutzi, a member of the fearsome band Dead Skeletons, is now operating under the name TAU accompanied by Venezuelan multi-instrumentalist Gerald Pasqualin. The mystical powers of the desert lands of the Real de Catorce in North West Mexico form the inspiration for the deeply psychedelic mind-trip EP entitled Wirikuta. Immerse yourself via Bandcamp. The full-length recording TAU TAU TAU landed in September via Fuzz Club and provides more transcendental psychedelia.

St. Tropez successfully played the mystery card for their reappearance, even if they dropped their veil of secrecy quickly. The guys rebranded themselves as garage punks and yacht rockers letting one track out through English blog DIY Mag: "Four guys making garage-punk in a former gay sauna by the canals of Amsterdam". Didn't take long to figure out that it was in fact a second beginning for Go Back To The Zoo. Out the window went the pop rock and in with the thrilling garage rock and live shows.

Born and raised in São Paolo, Brazil. Deejay  Irie currently lives in Groningen, The Netherlands. Gifted with a pair of hands that operate best at the speed of sound and a broad interest in styles and genres, Irie (his real name)  is one of The Netherlands most forthgoing, top notch turntablists, renowned for his skills. Visual DJ World Champion ever.

Between developing and performing theater shows, Irie kept himself busy by playing alongside and performing with acts like Mixmaster Mike, The Gaslamp Killer, KRS One, Jeru Da Damaja, Black Milk, Q-Bert, DJ Fly and Odyssee. 2015 is the year he won the DMC Online Visual DJ World Championship, making him their first

With 20 years experience under his belt, shows in all six the continents and a variety of artistic interests, Deejay Irie has proven time and time again that he can captivate the crowd with his unique style and character. Whether it's DJ'ing in a club, performing with jazz musicians, doing radio shows or creating theater shows and video content, Irie is guaranteed to bring his A-game, and leave the crowd behind with a big smile.

After ten years behind the decks and six champion titles in turntable-ism under his belt, plus a world champion title in 2011 as Beatbombers (with Stereossauro), meet Dj Ride. As a scratch avant-gardist, DJ, sound designer and producer the young Portuguese is an inherent part of the electronic and hiphop scene. Dj Ride fuses dubstep with hiphop at performances in clubs from Lisbon to London, Serbia to Poland and as opener for acts like Flying Lotus, Dam-Funk, A-Trak, Gaslamp Killer and Moderat.

They're raw, emotional, obviously wounded and intense. Black Foxxes are a trio from Exeter, UK that produce a dynamic mix of raw noise, pure melody and utterly immersive vocal breaks, recalling Brian Molko and Biffy Clyro. Their 2016 debut album I'm Not Well is an aptly titled effort that won't leave you unscathed, and they promise their live shows will make a big impression.

Youngr is a rising electronic pop talent from London (by way of New York and Manchester) who has become known for his one-take live videos. The success of these has already led to collaborations with Flight Facilities, Mahogany Blog and Morning Gloryville, as well as sponsorship from top studio brands like Roland, Sabian and Novation. Debut single Out Of My System ('A colossal, catchy pop anthem') has over 11 million streams on Spotify to date and has been heavily supported by BBC Radio 1.

Elegant, minimalist electronic pop and R&B straight from the band's bedrooms in Copenhagen. CHINAH created a phenomenal buzz on international blogs with the smart singles Away From Me and We Go Back, dubbed by Stereogum as 'precious, passion-driven synth-R&B of the finest order'. Their minimalistic electro pop and sophisticated R&B sound earned the Danish trio airplay on BBC 1 and BBC 6 and millions of streams on Spotify and Soundcloud. Debut EP Once The Lights Are On is sufficient proof of CHINAH's potential.

Goat Girl are Clottie Cream, Rosy Bones, Naima Jelly and L.E.D. They brew up rock with a garage feel and a particular twang, sort of country sleaze. It places the four girls at the forefront of an emerging set of groups from South London who have been inspired by the burgeoning local circuit there. Savvy and effortlessly inventive, Goat Girl are London in 2016.

Two generations of wayward, idealistic Dutch bands with a punk attitude clash in this duel: the brass of veterans De Kift versus the post-punk krautrock of Rats On Rafts from Rotterdam. The Rats reworked songs of De Kift and vice versa. The result clashes, gnashes, harasses... At times they're diametrically opposed, the next moment they melt together harmoniously, with pounding rhythms and raging guitars, and even horns! Rats and Kift together are one big ball of energy the bumps straight into you, then bounces off into another completely unexpected direction.

Punky and poppy garagerock from Portugal. Glockenwise are a foursome who effortlessly deliver catchy tunes with pop hooks and post-punk vibes. Influenced by the likes of MC5, Stooges, Thee Oh Sees, Ty Segall and Mac DeMarco, the youngsters tried to capture their infectious live sound on their latest album, Heat. And it seems they succeeded, according to various media outlets. Time to give Eurosonic a taste.

Main: SWITCH
03:15 - 04:15 Thee J Johanz (NL)
04:15 - 05:00 Strano (NL)
05:00 - 06:00 Mononoid (NL)

Visuals: Liza-Renee

Up: SWITCH
02:30 - 03:15 Former (NL)
03:15 - 04:00 Posij (NL)
04:00 - 04:45 Node B2B Beatstra (NL)
04:45 - 05:30 Nangdo (NL)

The band name translates as 'memory of a fish', by which Miguel Nicolau (guitar and loops) and Marco Franco (drums) mean that they are short of memory. But their songs seem to have the opposite effect, with their infectious, electronically-tinged indie pop sticking in your head like glue. Live, it gets even more hypnotic through the use of loops and improvisation. Next up is the visual and graphic adventure of their second album and introducing Memória de Peixe to the rest of Europe.

Experimental, psychedelic and magical pop from Norwich. Let's Eat Grandma is the brainchild of two wildly imaginative multi-instrumentalists and talented putative pop stars. Rosa and Jenny, both 17, met at the age of four and have been inseparable ever since. They only started playing music together four years ago and have since received airplay and recorded sessions for BBC Radio 1, Radio X and BBC 6 Music. In June they released their debut album, I, Gemini on Transgressive and they only sat their GCSEs last year.

Skott is anything but conventional. Growing up in a forest commune, the Swedish singer thrived in an environment run by 'outcast' folk musicians. Such an upbringing left this rising songwriter to do things her own way, and her first two singles, Porcelain and Wolf, are fragile, beautiful folk pop tracks that feature a quiet intensity behind her lyrical sketches.

Arabic music has been making waves in Europe, sometimes delivered by natives and lately acts like Acid Arab (France) and Cairo Liberation Front (Netherlands) have proven that you don't need to be from the region for a convincing interpretation. Temenik Electric are from Marseille, where the Maghreb is never far away. They fuse Maghrebi popular music with western rock riffs, electro and trance and set dance floors ablaze all over.

Isabel Fernández Reviriego wrote and played every sound that you hear on her electronic, poppy and psychedelic record Adieu Or Die. The music of the Basque born artist is densely melodic, like echoes of the American west coast in the 1960s coming through on Spanish radio. Amidst all the synthesisers and drum machines, the most prominent, playful thing that binds it all together is Reviriego's light and dancing voice, weaving circles around every song.

Dutch hip hop is booming and regularly delivering star performers. One of the brightest youngsters is Jonathan Fraser (22) from Zaandam, North of Amsterdam. He was introduced to hip hop at the age of 12, and it didn't take long for his hobby to turn into a career. Jonna Fraser distinguishes himself with his standout voice and delivery. He is part of New Wave, a collective of young hip hop artists that changed the Dutch music industry.

description: MICHELLE DAVID & THE GOSPEL SESSIONS  EXTRAVAGANZA
text: Onno Smit and Paul Willemsen discovered Michelle David when looking for a vocalist for Lefties Soul Connection. Then the tables turned and for some years it has been all about the incredible soulful voice of the American gospel queen. The Gospel Sessions Vol. 1 was an introduction to the project, going back to the origins and essence of gospel while adding a new, minimal approach. The rougher yet vulnerable Volume 2 erased all that you thought you knew about the genre and conquered all the festivals. Up next: The Gospel Sessions Vol. 3.

Rob Dekay left school at 15 to pursue his love of music. In 2010 his route took a serious turn when he ran into hiphop crew FATA. Four years later he supported rapper Akwasi on his solo tour and in 2015 he and Dio created the song Leuke Meisjes. In the meantime Rob worked on his solo career. He played multiple festivals and Top Notch released his debut EP filled with wayward soulful country pop.

Orange Skyline's rapid ascend in the Dutch industry is one out of the books. Performing over 40 festivals in one year such as Concert at Sea and Eurosonic/Noorderslag. Supporting Kensington at sold out Ziggo Dome shows. Having high rotation on 3FM radio, De Wereld Draait Door and being nominated for an Edison award is all quite an achievement if you know that Orange Skyline's debutalbum has yet to be released.
'Things That I Hide' will be released on January 13th and is co-produced by Kraak & Smaak's Oscar de Jong. Their first single 'Sound & Fury' is a good tastemaker of things to come for this Groningen based indie-pop band.

KOFFIE has its roots in Afrobeat, jazz and modern electronic music. The music also features  influences from Fela Kuti and James Brown to Red Hot Chilli Peppers, Flying Lotus and Miles Davis. The eight boys from Amsterdam turn this Afrofunk blend into a steaming and groove-filled show that has been praised for its combination of virtuosity, groove and energy. In February it's time for the release of KOFFIE's third album Huntu.

Hailing from Enschede, The Netherlands, Mandrake's Monster combines rock with dark elements, inspired by Queens of the Stone Age, Foo Fighters and Arctic Monkeys. Five friends touring across Europe in an old camper van is how the story began three years ago. Since then the band has played over 150 shows, including international DIY tours, festivals and showcases and The Global Rock Summit (in LA), When Copenhell Freezes over (Copenhagen, DK), and Eurosonic Noorderslag. With their new material, recorded recently at AIR studios in London, the band is ready for some major action in 2017.

Seramic brands himself as 'the new alternative hipster gospel artist from London signed to Parlophone'. Using elements of Jungle, Prince and Jack Garratt in his music, as well as adding a hint of dramatic backing vocals for effect, he's probably got a point. He played a range of taste maker festivals across Europe this summer, supported Jack Garratt on his UK November tour and plans to release his second EP very soon.

The kind of musical fusion DaGamba conjure up is pretty much unheard of. Their music is equally impressive when playing Beethoven or rocking out to Led Zeppelin or on a classical version of the Knightrider theme. These academically skilled players from Riga, Latvia use classical instruments and spectacular rhythms to mix a seemingly disparate set of musical cultures into a unique and powerful sound.

Die Höchste Eisenbahn is back with a new record. After the unexpected success of their debut in 2013 there was huge anticipation from both fans and media. And so finally again are the Germans with amazing songs like Lisbeth and Gierig  making endlessly playful pop music telling charming short stories. You will discover laid-back Fleetwood Mac vibes, a little bit of Talking Heads craziness and some of the folk-funk of Allan Brother in their songs.

Started through the chance discovery of a Casio keyboard on the streets of Neukölln in Berlin, Magic Island went on to develop her signature synth melodies and unexpected harmonies, providing a sanctuary between digital and analogue production. Saccharine melodies and raw vocals echo through the songs on her Intoxicated Sunset and Wasted Dawn EP's. Her lo-fi dream pop has matured in sound, production and experience, leading to debut LP Like Water, due for release early this year.

AVI ON FIRE is the new and first solo project of Bram Wesdorp, former frontman of Neighbour Neighbour and now part of Yellow Grass. Now his new band AVI ON FIRE is here, with quirky songs that never go out of your head. Alternative pop music with a touch of Foster the People, some MGMT, Phoenix and Foals, but most of all AVI.
The first single 'Pearls' was released in the summer of 2016 and got over 500k plays on Spotify within 2 months. With this single AVI was invited to play on Dutch national television, became '3FM Serious Talent' and got a lot of attention on international blogs. With a second single early next year, the future is bright for this young band. Strange? A little bit. Hits? You decide.
"Avi On Fire's debut single is called "Pearls," and it's a huge piece of chorus-centric indie pop reminiscent of bands like Grizzly Bear and Passion Pit in their heyday. It's a format that has been all but abandoned in favor of sleek electronic, minimal pop, and and hip-hop influence, but "Pearls" is proof that a big, hummable slice of indie pop can still hit the spot. Of those yummy, indeed." - Pigeons & Planes, 2016.

MICH is a new project of members from Amsterdam bands Aux Raus (hardcore techno punk), Le Le (electronic pop) and singer-songwriter Sofie Winterson on bass. This time around they surprise with a fresh blend of new wave and shoe-gaze, influenced by the likes of The Cure and Dead Moon. Excelsior Recordings will release their debut album in early 2017.

KIOL is a songwriter and musician born in 1997. His songs are full of pop melodies, alternative folk and bluesy rhythms and are influenced by examples like Paolo Nutini, Jack Bugg, James Bay and Ed Sheeran. During his Irish period he has been encouraged to sing by some Irish fellas who decided to call him "CEOL", pronounced "KIOL", that means MUSIC in Gaelic. The teenager signed a worldwide publishing contract with CTM Entertainment and he will release his first EP just during Eurosonic Noorderslag. We bet you'll like it!

Ronnie Flex is a man with a plan. He has carried it around in his head for years, consequently the realisation simply comes down to following the steps that he has taken countless times in his mind. It is this plan that motivates the young Dutchman to create hundreds of beats, to endlessly refine his raps and continuously try to make his productions better, tighter and more versatile. Ronnie Flex is planning to become the biggest hip hop artist that The Netherlands has ever seen.

What happens when you put an Icelandic singer-songwriter in Spain? Ask Mani Orrason, or even better: listen to his recent EP Wake Me Up, full of warm and folky pop songs. The multi-instrumentalist from Reykjavík debuted at the age of 16 with single Fed All My Days, which went straight to number one in Iceland. He has been touring Europe for years and will be releasing his second album in 2017.

SMIB is a brand run by a hiphop/R&B collective made up of nine artists, mostly from the South-Eastern suburbs of Amsterdam. Each artists has their own solo career but they also perform as a collective. SMIB consists of Ray Fuego, GRGY, Tads Thots, GHQST, and producer KC. Apart from music SMIB is involved in several other projects, such as organising a yearly festival, a clothing line and movies, but music will always be their core business. They just released debut EP Bakuhatsu.

With a voice that has the soul of blues and the gravelly tones of Tom Waits, young Fil Bo Riva strikes you immediately. The 23-year-old is what you could call a 'true European'. He is half-Italian, hailing from Rome, grew up in Ireland and took off to Berlin, where he learned his craft busking in the streets. There Filippo Bonamici, the voice behind Fil Bo Riva, met like-minded guitarist Felix A.Remm and producer Robert Stephenson (Mighty Oaks). PIAS released their debut EP If You're Right, It's Alright in September, 2016.

Vera Jonas Experiment from Budapest is about music from the soul for the soul and the feet. An amalgamation of traditional singer-songwriting and indie, jazz, experimental music, loops, soul, funk and sweet melodies. The latest album Tiger, now! was released in April, 2016. Since then the band has been on tour in Hungary, Romania and Slovakia, playing clubs and festivals.

Kid Flicks is the project of Greek-born, London-based producer and songwriter Nickos Dervisis, known for his genre-bending style of psychedelic pop, electronics and world music. And for his explosive live performances, his backing  trio combines electronics with a live rhythm section. He was praised by various media outlets including The 405, DIY, Impose, CBC, No Fear of Pop, and, on top of that, his self-titled LP was released through Klik and Wordandsound Records.

Introducing themselves as 'brave female-fronted heavy flute Kraut Rock Proto Metal from Germany!', Wucan are a four-piece led by the angelic voice and flute of Francis Tobolsky. Named after one of the prize songs of Canadian psych rockers Black Mountain this band from Dresden taps into true classic rock, and also throws in a theremin.

In January 2016 Jett Rebel released the album Truck, featuring no less than 27 songs and a refreshing approach: "Money should never be a motive for making music. My motive for this record is that this is what I wanted to make. It is what it is. I played and recorded everything myself with a 4-track cassette recorder." Truck is part 1 of a trilogy and part 2 Don't Die On Me followed in August. The talented Dutchman arrives at Eurosonic to play a solo show, and then goes on to play his biggest show ever in the legendary Ahoy venue on February 4.

Luxembourg singer-songwriter Jerome Reuter founded his project ROME in 2005 and has since created an authoritative body of work of eleven albums. His compelling brand of dark folk merges influences from post-punk to chanson. Inspired by world literature, Reuter's particularly accessible concept albums combine his interest in history, philosophy and arts. The live, intimate version of ROME is a duo with Reuter on acoustic guitar and Eric Becker on E-Guitar. The other is a loud band with singalong hymns and up-tempo beats.

Folk from Brighton from a singer with a voice that reminds of Holly Golightly, Angel Olsen and Lana Del Rey. Bella Union was quick to sign the exciting talent that is Holly Macve and will release her first album in February. Singles No One Has The Answers and We Don't Know Where We Are Going show her exceptional gift for writing moving, rootsy songs that grip you with their dark undertone and themes. 20-year-old Holly Macve was named as one of their favourite artists at SXSW by The Guardian and NPR.

Steeped in melodrama; The Eskies skip through the dark side of anything that makes you want to dance. The Irishmen bring together a special brand of folk-noir and gypsy-jazz that creates a swaggering mix of brassy funereal marches and knees up Klezmer tunes. Last album After The Sherry Went Round was described as 'a raucous fanfare of folk, swamp blues and unquenchable merriment, paired with brain-burrowing melodies and witty lyrics, delivered at breakneck speed'.

The Magic Gang are four kids from the south of England who now all live together in a house in Brighton and make music all day, like The Monkees. They claim to make laser guided guitar pop songs that sound like the point that Steely Dan intersects with Weezer. The four piece certainly knows how to craft perfect pop songs that are sweet, harmonious, catchy and loaded with hit potential. The debut album will be released next year.

An exciting Slovakian band that is making waves all over Europe. The Ills were voted into the 'Top 25 most exciting gigs at Iceland Airwaves Music Festival' by Consequence Of Sound, which is a big thing considering they make instrumental music. Not surprising though if you listen to their excellent album Ornamental Or Mental, showcasing well-constructed compositions that venture from post-rock to shoe-gaze, math and prog-rock and usually end in intense, gripping  crescendos.

At just 19 years old Charlotte Brimner has already experienced some major career boosts. She was invited to SXSW twice and played Scotland's biggest pop festival T In The Park. The second single of her group Be Charlotte went straight into the Spotify Viral Top 50. Machines That Breathe is a catchy indie electro-pop song that has 'hit' and 'great future' written all over it. Keep an eye on this talented Scottish multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter, who has been dubbed "The most exciting emerging artist in ages" by BBC Radio 1.

Influences include Björk, PJ Harvey and Moderat, making her "one of the most innovative minds in modern British Music", according to Pitchfork. Anna Meredith already had an established career in the classical world and had released two EPs, when the composer and producer released debut album Varmints on Moshi Moshi Records in March 2016 to even more critical acclaim. She performs with her band of classical musicians and a line-up of electronics, clarinet, cello, tuba, guitar and drums, and The Guardian awarded her live show with 5 stars, calling it "a triumph".

A Bulgarian band with a German name and English lyrics providing some alternative rock and rock 'n roll. Der Hunds is a rare breed, with a ripping voice not unlike Axl Rose, singer Boby Mudolov fronts a wall of sound of heavy guitar riffs, roaring bass and smashing beats. While the follow-up is in the works, give their latest album Blue Animals a spin.

With a deliberately deceptive name this group from Latvia comes to rock your house with dance beats. Bandmaster features one of the country's leading DJ/producers (Rudd), producer Andis Ansons and notorious Baltic battle rapper Vina. They throw in a lot of boiling analogue synths, electronic beats and some infectious tunes. Give Me A Taste is particularly hard to get out of your head.

It won't be easy to avoid falling into the 'trap' of Camp Claude. The Paris-based trio makes suave electro pop that is wavy and intriguing, and at the same time cheerful and poppy. A bit like London Grammar they combine beats with a smooth seductive voice that belongs to Franco-American singer Diane Sagnier. She is supported by the Brit Mike Giffts and the Swede Leo Hellden in this very international group.

Is it still possible to create your own genre or niche in the year 2016? It certainly is, as MHD shows with his 'Afro Trap' movement. The young Frenchman has earned himself a huge following online (over 100 million views on his YouTube channel alone) and in the streets of France. His mixture of traditional African music with hiphop and trap is hyper contagious and sure to make  any crowd dance.

Electronic and psychedelic pop from Switzerland made by Cedric Streuli, a.k.a. Buvette. He has just released his fourth album Elasticity via Pan European Recording and it's full of magical pop with unexpected twists, electro beats, robotic singing and heavy synths that bring some heart-warming 80s nostalgia to Eurosonic.

The 21st Century has delivered some excellent European songwriters who thrive on a fragile voice and delicate songs. Think of Damien Rice or Ed Sheeran, and in a few years, you'll be able to add Damian Lynn to that list. The talented songwriter from Switzerland released his debut album Count To Ten in 2015, spearheaded by tender hit single Memories. On Show My Love To You he adds a Mumford And Sons like folk feel and tasteful samples. The end of 2016 sees Lynn, accompanied live by a drummer and loop station, making his mark on the German market with a second tour.

This is beautiful mellow folk music from Norway. Siv Jakobsen likes listening to Laura Marling and Ane Brun and she likes to fill her songs with unfiltered thoughts and reflections and her secrets. She has supported artists like SOAK, Highasakite and American folk artist Damien Jurado on his UK and Irish tour. After praise from blogs like The Line Of Best Fit and airplay on radio stations BBC 6 Music and XFM radio, Jakobsen recorded her debut album in London with producer Matt Ingram, known for his work with Marling, Florence and the Machine, Lianne La Havas and Jake Bugg.

Mario Batkovic is an accordionist who says he isn't interested in genres. He isn't that easy to classify either. What we can say is that he learned to play in Bosnia and now operates from Switzerland as a composer and songwriter for various projects. His music is (contemporary) classical and influenced by jazz, minimalism, Balkan sounds with an experimental edge. He also works closely with Geoff Barrow (of Portishead fame), has just released his solo album on Bristol based record label Invada Records and performed at the prestigious ATP, Montreux Jazz and Le Guess Who? Festivals.

Azekel Adesuyi is a Nigerian-born British singer-songwriter, musician and producer from London. Under the stage name Azekel he debuted in February 2013 with the Circa EP, featuring  electronic R&B carried by his husky soulful voice. Azekel released the Raw, Vol. 1 (2015) and Raw, Vol. 2 (2016) EPs and collaborated with legendary Bristol group Massive Attack on the title track of the their Ritual Spirit EP.

Considering their age, they seem to be students rather than career academics, but, boy, when they grab their guitar, harmonica, bass and drums, they really go nuts and become virtuoso professors that will give you a lesson to remember! Good old rock'n'roll with young blood and spirit, taking the best from the heritage of blues, funk and psychedelic rock'n'roll and making their own explosive mixture to blow your ears and hearts away while your legs do funny things. The Professors have been one of the hardest working live bands in the past years, taking to the stages at all manner of clubs, bars, streets, venues and TV shows in Slovenia, Europe and now they are arround the States, playing in New York, St. Louis, Memphis, New Orleans, Austin Texas, Tucson Arizona, San Francisco, Berkley, San Jose, ... Each gig increased their word of mouth reputation and number of wacky fans that range from teenagers to the elderly.

Easily one of the most bizarre and infectious bands you will see at Eurosonic. Citing influences like Manu Chao and Gogol Bordello to System of a Down,Bohemian Betyars is a band where folk meets rock. Or rather: where speed folk meets freak punk. The band name is derived from the Hungarian words Bohém (cheerful people living an unconventional lifestyle) and Betyár (18th century outlaw bandits turned folk heros). Nowadays it stands for a well seasoned Hungarian party band that gets any crowd moving with their rocking punk and ska with Balkan and Gipsy spices.

This creation of Irish duo Morgan MacIntyre and Gemma Doherty is hauntingly beautiful. Saint Sister draw from early Celtic harp traditions, 60s folk and electronic pop to create 'atmosfolk': a mix of soulful vocal harmonies, dreamy synths and electro-acoustic harp. Debut EP Madrid, was produced by Alex Ryan (Hozier), and the band played SXSW, Glastonbury, Electric Picnic, Reeperbahn and Latitude. Expect their highly anticipated debut album in 2017.

David Douglas (NL) is without doubt one of the most expressive electronica producers around. His work got incredible support by the likes of Pitchfork, BBC Music, Vice, Traxx, 3voor12 and XLR8R, to mention a few. On stage David Douglas crafts his productions to a more energetic completeness. His live sets are known for the pile of gear he brings including a Space Echo that is signature for his sound. Playing shows at PITCH Festival, Best Kept Secret, Reeperbahn, Glimps and Into The Woods, Douglas brings music with confidence and has inspired him to write a new album expected for early 2017.  Olde Gods (ES) is the joint venture of Guillamino (Bankrobber, Third Ear, ICAN, RBMA) and JMII (100% Silk, Hivern Discs), whose tracks have gotten support by acts like John Talabot, Simian Mobile Disco and Jennifer Cardini. The duo from Barcelona debuted on their own label Minor Planets with a vinyl trilogy and the next single None Of These Bitches (in Daikanyama) was released via Atomnation. The Dutch label will also release their EP early this year.  Atomnation resident Will Oirson (NL) proved to be an awesome selector of warm driven techno sounds, he appeared at clubs and festivals like Trouw, Studio 80, STRP, Paradigm, Woodstock, Straf_Werk, Welcome To The Future and hosts an own show at Red Light Radio.

Bry is an Irish singer/songwriter with a unique approach to life. Using social media as his voice, the young Irish man's life goal is to travel to (and perform in) every single country in the world. Thus far, 62 countries have already been ticked off the list in just a few years. After the singles Don't Go Alone and You're Alright, his self-titled album will come out early this year.

Reykjavíkurdætur (the daughters of Reykjavík) are a sixteen-piece, all-female rap group from Reykjavík. Since the release of their first single in 2013 they have gotten worldwide recognition for daring lyrics and a dynamic stage performance. The group performs in solos, duos, trios and sometimes with all sixteen together. This makes for a show like no other where the (f)emcees spit in both Icelandic and English about topics such as sexual violence, politics, sexual freedom and first world hype. It is safe to say Iceland had never seen anything like it, and you probably haven't either.

Macedonian post-punkers that have, over the years, taken up a more electronic approach. Bernays Propaganda are actually post-punk activists and singer Kristina Gorovska vents their strong political views in their own language. They played over 400 shows all over Europe, Russia and US and released four full-length albums (on Moonlee Records) plus a split 7" with Mike Watt, which makes them one of the region's most successful young bands. Their music flirts with electronic new-wave, recalling the early 80s sound of New Order as well as German indie-tronic kings The Notwist.

Meet Gli Sportivi, two guys from Venice, Italy who sounding like a small army. They play 'Fuzz 'n Roll', or rather lo-fi garage blues with a creepy fuzz guitar and apocalyptic drums. Gli Sportivi use hand-made instruments like "The Stick of Death", a one stringed instrument that is supposed to sound like a chainsaw chopping the stage. Be warned: the duo has 'reached a destructive level'.

FlexFab is the kind of producer that understands that you need a little extra effort to make an electronic show work. Throw in a mask, some lights and a lot of smoke and you enhance the impact of that trap and future bass by a factor of 5. Musically the young Swiss producer has more tricks up his sleeve. He throws punches with innovative rhythms, out of this world electronics and particularly destructive bass. Did we mention his mega hit Zoo and his even better latest record Manoir? FlexFab is the future of bass.

For fans of The Shins, or Frank Turner, Against Me!, Mumford and Sons and Bob Dylan, there is the joy of We Bless This Mess. The 5-piece band from Porto is in fact a solo project by Nelson Graf Reis, that takes the punk approach to folk music and live performances, or, equally, that plays punk songs according to the 'less is more' philosophy. We Bless This Mess is all about expressing positivity and carpe diem: "We breathe, we are alive. This is the greatest gift."

Call it indie disco pop or funk infused disco with nineties R&B, Ekkah sure have something that's catchy, smooth, funky, uplifting and sexy enough to fill up dance floors. London-based duo Rebecca Wilson and Rebekah Pennington released some brilliant tracks including the Last Chance To Dance EP and got strong airplay support from BBC Radio 1 and 6. They played Glastonbury twice and supported Kylie, Chic, Grace Jones and Take That in Hyde Park.

Is there such a thing as too many guitarists in a band? Finland's Teksti-TV 666 think not. Formed three years ago, things have escalated rather quickly for the seven-piece shoe-gazing kraut-punk monster. Armed with no less than five (at times six) electric guitars, Teksti-TV 666 are nowadays one of the most in-demand live acts in their native Finland, and select performances abroad have caused a storm as well. After a Finnish tour with Kvelertak in the autumn, the band will set their sights on Europe, beginning with a tour in Norway and then at Eurosonic.

Rock band Kensington have released their new album Control. The first single of the album is Do I Ever. "What do I know, I ought to grow but do I ever?" singer Eloi Youssef asks in this grand rock song about vulnerability and surrender. With Control, the band (which apart from Youssef consists of guitarist Casper Starreveld, bass player Jan Haker and drummer Niles Vandenberg), have made their most ambitious and intense record yet. It's also their most personal, and introspective.

Control is the follow-up to Kensington's 2014 release Rivals, the two times platinum album that brought them to clubs and festival stages all over Europe and built them a solid fan base around the continent. European Festivals Kensington played at include Sziget, EXIT, Frequency, Gurten, Life Festival, Werchter, Lowlands and Pinkpop. The album included the hit singles Streets, War, Riddles, and Done With It.

World famous dj Armin van Buuren also teamed up with the band for the international hit single Heading Up High. As part of this collaboration, Kensington have joined Armin on his Armin Only World Tour, visiting arenas all over the world, including China, Brazil, Australia and the US.

The band, whose 2013 hit song Home Again was featured in an international Jack Wolfskin commercial, will kick off its own European headline tour early 2017. In February and March, they will play venues of up to 7,000 people in Germany, Belgium, Austria, Switzerland, Poland, the Czech Republic and Hungary. At the end of the year they will play 5 sold out shows at the Amsterdam Ziggo Dome in Holland.

The new album Control is a statement about the here and now. The lyrics on Control, all written by singer Eloi Youssef, are more personal than ever before. Besides using his own life as a source of inspiration, he's also a keen observer of the people around him.

Here is a blend of shoegaze indie pop and the kind of post-punk that you'd normally expect from Britain, Manchester, and Creation Records to be more precise. This particular four-piece consists of two brothers and two of their high school friends from Denmark who sound as versatile and gifted as a young Primal Scream or Stone Roses, or rather: the big hope of the Copenhagen indie scene.

In for a dark, twisted, hypnotic dance party? Trust the Viagra Boys to provide it. The story goes they were formed when an expelled criminal from the US met two local guys in Stockholm over some beers. They started making music inspired by Suicide and Joy Division among others. Their mission is to find out if a 'punk band can rely solely on repetitive drum patterns and driving bass lines without falling down the rabbit hole that is pretentious post-punk drool?' In short: 'They are the soundtrack to making out in public, nosebleeds and a conga line till you barf'.

Sassy garage pop and lo-fi songs from 'the most exciting new band from Berlin'. Gurr sounds like a trashy sixties girl group with poppy vocals and two voices with a flavour of eeriness 'dug out from the deep darkness that is the Berlin rock 'n' roll bar's restroom at 5am'.  Try their 2016 debut album In My Head for some great tunes, laidback garage and 'first wave gurrrlcore'.

Lion Kojo is one of the up-and-coming names of Amsterdam. The DJ and producer makes a diverse style, rooted in the broad spectrum he used to listen to as a young kid with big dreams: from Biggie, Madlib, UK Garage & Bass, Opgezwolle, Mighty Diamonds and Habib Koité to Sade, Hudson Mohawke and Grace Jones. He finished his music academy and earned residencies at Bassline (Paradiso, Amsterdam) and CHIPS (BAR, Rotterdam). Lion also showed his huge potential at big Dutch festivals like Lowlands and Down The Rabbit Hole.

description: Batida apresenta: The Almost Perfect DJ
text:
It has been proven that the most appreciated skill on a DJ is to keep his arm raised as much as he can and that is usually corresponded with appreciation in the form of noise. The purpose of this performance is to evaluate the limit of appreciation achieved by this exercise. How much can we celebrate an upright arm? By repetition, over 60 minutes, the side effect may be a total disassociation between the gesture and any demonstration of affection from the audience.


*You may hear a big number of Unshazaamable tracks, mostly from own, unreleased and favorite productions. Some of them will empty the dancefloor and others will amaze you forever. Almost. At some point there won't be much for you to stare at so you can focus on music and eventually dance like there is nothing more important to do on a DJ set.

Referring to themselves an 'outsider ouija psych pop super group' and a fictional band, the Moonlandingz is actually made up of members of The Eccentronic Research Council from Sheffield with front man Lias Saoudi and guitarist Saul Adamczewski of psychedelic punks The Fat White Family. Sean Lennon co-produced their second EP, an album should follow early 2017 and it's safe to say they will bring on the most eccentric, druggy and addictive trip of Eurosonic.

Singer-songwriter URSINA was born and raised in a small Swiss mountain village, where her musical universe consisted of classical music and Romansch folk songs. She majored in jazz studies and is especially captivated by Scandinavian artists like Ane Brun, Efterklang, and Jose Gonzalez, releasing her debut EP when living in Denmark. Back in Switzerland, she started writing songs mixing northern influences with her Romansch folk roots and with subtle, finely crafted pop and a lucid voice. Praised as one of the most interesting upcoming Swiss artists, she will release her debut album this month.

How often does an artist achieve such an impact with their first single? In the rare case of the just 20-year-old Finnish songwriter ALMA it's all about talent and songwriting. Debut song Karma is one of those instant pop gems that are destined to end up in the year-end lists and several award nominations. It has earned her comparisons to Rihanna, or 'the voice of Amy Winehouse with Crystal Castles' electronic pop'. She scored a second hit with German EDM-producer Felix Jaehn, is signed to two major labels and her debut album comes out this spring. Perfect timing for Eurosonic.

Catherine and Lizzy Ward Thomas have proved that the UK can produce high quality country pop. The sisters from London have just delivered their second album Cartwheel full of pop gems like the emotional title track and the more uptempo Carry You Home. Their songwriting skills are evident and performances at Glastonbury, London's O2 Arena and national TV have wormed their way into the hearts of a large UK audience. There is no doubt Europe will fall for these angelic singing sisters too.

Remarkable alternative rap from Tallinn, that is gaining street cred. Tommy Cash grew up in the Baltic ghetto in the midst of Russian art and pop music and first expressed himself through painting and dancing. His latest conquest is hip hop with Russian carpets, centaurs, green lasers and Adidas tights. His lyrics and videos are hilarious, but at the same time his sound is not to be taken lightly. It's hyper infectious and it's been raining 'Euroz Dollarz Yeniz' since the release of his debut album.

With a name that could easily be German, English or French, a voice like a seasoned native English singer and soulful electronic pop that seems remarkably mature for Eurosonic entrance level, Joan Thiele is a mystery in many ways. Facts: Italian mother, Swiss father, grown up in Colombia, went to England after high school and she clearly likes AlunaGeorge, Ry x, Flume, Little Dragon and Lianne La Havas. Her impressive recent album with hits Save Me and Taxi Driver make her one of the must-see acts at Eurosonic.

Noise pop performed solo by GIUNGLA , a.k.a. Emanuela Drei, Italian-born singer-songwriter based in Bologna. Giungla means 'jungle' in Italian. It refers to a rich environment with many and varied forms of life. In this sort of happy place, where there's no room for reason and control, Drei created minimal pop songs with an in-your-face attitude. Songs that hover between PJ Harvey, Grimes and The xx. So far there is only the Camo EP released in May 2016 to listen to, and the live show to look forward to.

Ryan Hennessy and Jimmy Rainsford are fans of The Script, Oasis and The 1975, and that explains why they make boisterous, energetic pop rock with stadium-sized, anthemic songs. Strong stuff from the Irish duo, who already completed a sold-out UK/Irish tour including three nights in the Olympia Theatre. They rocked Electric Picnic 2016 as well, and their debut EP went straight to number one in August 2016.

Txarango is the Catalan group with the most international appeal at the moment. More than 300 concerts in 19 countries and 4 continents, headlining big festivals, the 500.000 album downloads or two golden records serve as proof of such a claim. They returned the love by funding a cultural centre in Senegal, travelling to Palestine (with Clowns Without Borders) and to Idomeni to help refugees. their sound is an impressive fusion of Caribbean, Latin and Mediterranean music with a message.

At only 22 years old Amy Becker has stormed her way through the past few years, displaying a unique ability to mix genres, while expressing an impeccable selection of everything from dancehall to hip hop and grime to UK funky and also more obscure bass music.

His demo Even If It's A Lie swiftly generated 2.7 million Spotify-plays and saw Matt Maltese fully immerse himself in the emerging music scene of South London. Influenced by role models like Leonard Cohen and Nick Cave the 20-year-old singer-songwriter recorded his debut EP late at night in his bedroom, singing quietly so as not to wake his housemates. His new single is produced by Hugo White from The Maccabees and takes a darker more political route.

London raised artist/songwriter/producer was advised by Adele to attend the prestigious BRIT school in London (which Amy Winehouse attended as well). He became the first ever continental European to graduate. Altrego is currently recording his debut album with Jim Eliot (Ellie Goulding, Kylie Minogue etc.) in the Welsh countryside set to release in 2017. Expect popsongs with a grain of electronica and a pinch of funk.

Martin Kohlstedt is a young, experimental pianist, composer and producer, who made his mark with two remarkable albums called Tag (Day) and Nacht (Night). His music unites classical (acoustisc) piano with a Fender Rhodes, as well as electronic adventures and beats. He also produces music for games and movies. To this German artist, steel and wood, classical and  modern all feel like one big world of possibilities. He is the master that weaves emotional carpets. No wonder they call him 'the next Nils Frahm'.

Áine Cahill is a 21 year old singer-songwriter from County Cavan, Ireland. She is inspired by modern music and combines that with her love of classic jazz from the 1950's, which got her performing on festival stages from Glastonbury to Electric Picnic. With her moving sound and evocative writing style, Áine captivates the listener; her storytelling and vivid imagery allowing her audience to escape into her world.

You can count on Belgium to come up with the next big thing in many a genre. Mustii is another new gem, you can bet on him becoming pretty huge in electronic pop. The young man from Brussels was actually trained as a professional actor and has worked as a writer, composer, singer and stage director. Good thing he chose to pursue his love for 80ies synth pop and new wave, fusing it into his very own blend of theatrical electro pop. Next February his first EP will be released including the singles Feed Me and The Golden Age.

Rejjie Snow has been rhyming since he was just a kid in Dublin. After moving to Savannah, Georgia (US) at 17 on a soccer scholarship, he decided to pursue music instead and dropped his experimental first mixtape Rejovich. The EP introduced the world to his surreal style and villainous eloquence, quickly amassing over six million plays.

Echo Beatty is a pop noir band from Antwerp influenced by both psychedelic folk and dark blues. The hypnotic voice of Annelies Van Dinter sounds like it was tapped straight from the heart  of Beth Gibbons and PJ Harvey. Their album NONETHELESS is a perfect mix of voodoo ballads, dark blues and psychedelic fury. These rambling souls will prove their status as one of the great talents of Belgium pretty soon.

Singer-songwriter JP Cooper has a voice that allows him to transcend genres. The pop gem September Song features his effortless and immediately recognisable voice. The track has won the Manchester artist many loyal fans across the UK and praise from colleagues Stormzy, Ed Sheeran and Shawn Mendes as well as BBC Radio 1, Clash Magazine and other media.
