Four guys from Barcelona and Mallorca deliver  guitars soaked with shimmering chorus effects, driving bass lines, a touch of fuzz and high-speed tempos to create upbeat music with a surf vibe. On 2014's The Sea, Beach Beach mix 80's jangle pop with 90's indie rock and classic rock from the 70's. 2017 will see the Spaniards release their third album, which for sure will make hearts beat faster.

A storyteller at heart, teenager Mahalia's unassuming songwriting expresses an innocent gift for melody and a natural affinity for imaginative narratives. The singer-songwriter from Leicester makes subtle and delicate music emboldened by exultant choruses and a vocal that is both sweet and raw. After supports for Ed Sheeran, Laura Mvuala, Emile Sande, Tom Odell and Lianne La Havas, plus an appearance at Glastonbury 2016 it is time to conquer Europe.

:papercutz is the electronic pop project of Portugese producer Bruno Miguel, which has evolved into a fully-fledged act with vocalist Catarina Miranda and (live) percussionist Gonçalo Lemos. Their music soon saw them going from gothic Porto to shows all over Europe, Asia and the US, where they played SXSW. They love analogue synths, pop vocals, intense percussion, cinematic piano ambience and a careful balance between acoustic and electronic sounds on their tracks. On their next album they plan to explore more African folk percussion and dark electronics.

What happens when you put an Icelandic singer-songwriter in Spain? Ask Mani Orrason, or even better: listen to his recent EP Wake Me Up, full of warm and folky pop songs. The multi-instrumentalist from Reykjavík debuted at the age of 16 with single Fed All My Days, which went straight to number one in Iceland. He has been touring Europe for years and will be releasing his second album in 2017.

Calling J.C. Satàn unique would be selling the French band short. Imagine Queens Of The Stone Age backing Serge Gainsbourg during Mexico's Day Of The Dead. Brutal and complex, furious and spirit-evoking, the new album of this group from Bordeaux hits the nail of black-garage-gospel with the hammer of Viking gods, right in the middle of a storm of decibels that mount the pressure, electrically charged by each of J.C. Satàn's shows.

Lion Kojo is one of the up-and-coming names of Amsterdam. The DJ and producer makes a diverse style, rooted in the broad spectrum he used to listen to as a young kid with big dreams: from Biggie, Madlib, UK Garage & Bass, Opgezwolle, Mighty Diamonds and Habib Koité to Sade, Hudson Mohawke and Grace Jones. He finished his music academy and earned residencies at Bassline (Paradiso, Amsterdam) and CHIPS (BAR, Rotterdam). Lion also showed his huge potential at big Dutch festivals like Lowlands and Down The Rabbit Hole.

After two EPs, First Hate is gearing up for their highly anticipated debut album to be released this year. The Copenhagen duo have been climbing steadily into the international spotlight since the release of their self-titled debut EP in September 2014 and hit singles Girls In The Club and In My Dreams, songs that typify their catchy, synth-heavy indie pop and its original vocal style. They have  also accompanied fellow Copenhagen residents Lust For Youth on tours across Europe, Asia and North America.

For fans of The Shins, or Frank Turner, Against Me!, Mumford and Sons and Bob Dylan, there is the joy of We Bless This Mess. The 5-piece band from Porto is in fact a solo project by Nelson Graf Reis, that takes the punk approach to folk music and live performances, or, equally, that plays punk songs according to the 'less is more' philosophy. We Bless This Mess is all about expressing positivity and carpe diem: "We breathe, we are alive. This is the greatest gift."

Opening for Justin Bieber's Purpose World Tour 2016 hasn't done Eskei83 any harm of course. But let's not forget the German producer is responsible for some real dancefloor filling club tracks a.k.a. certified bangers as he calls them. Added to that, Eskei83 is a DJ with an insane live performance. He is the Red Bull Thre3Style World Champion of 2014 and is booked from Los Angeles to Taipei and Moscow.

Chui are an up-and-coming young trio from Croatia with a special take on jazz. Their potent blend of dance club rythms, jazz vocabulary, electronics with turbo-charged jazz/rock fusion, plus a relentless commitment to groove, permeates their albums from start to finish. On third record Third Sun From The Stone, Chui have established themselves as a mainstay of the Central European music scene.

Six strings on a guitar, a casio keyboard and a drumkit, that's all these two guys from the south of Belgium need to create a frantic mixture of Kraut, noise and math rock. Just a few breaks and three chords and you can raise the temperature considerably, as Jim and Reggie from La Jungle clearly show. Their utter frenzy is accompanied by metallic riffs, huge waves of noise and storms of toms and cymbals all lead by a stroboscope. Here, rock goes back to its primitive and primal core.

Sexy music from Denmark, that blends funk, R&B, hip hop and some reggae in a smooth and laid back style. Black Dylan is a cutting-edge duo featuring the platinum-selling star Wafande and longtime collaborator and producer Nuplex. Their debut album Hey Stranger is full of sweet tunes, and will surely be acclaimed one of the most sophisticated listens of 2016.

similar.artistName: MICHELLE DAVID & THE GOSPEL SESSIONS  EXTRAVAGANZA

text: Swedish dreampop of stunning beauty with a dark side, a twist that makes her music all the more interesting. Adna decided to become a musician at a very young age, explored the sensitivity and fragility of music in school and moved to Berlin in 2014. A few months later she released her debut album Night, followed by the impressive Run Lucifer, a year later. Her last single Overthinking takes her on an even deeper, intense trip, that you just have to be part of.

Garage rock trio Abdomen from Friesland (NL) do not shy away from noise and fuzz pedals, nor from catchy songs that are full of addictive choruses and inflammatory rhythms. They have just come back from Leeds, where they recorded their debut album with Matt Peel, known for his productions for bands like Bad Breeding, Eagulls and Pulled Apart By Horses.

Bedfordshire outfit CC Smugglers started out as "guerrilla buskers", hijacking queues of music fans  waiting to see other artists, or commandeering underground trains and escalators. They make the best American folk music with a dash of swing, jazz, country, ragtime and bluegrass, and on top of that they also manage to sneak in some contemporary influences like hip hop, metal, dubstep, house and dancehall. Hearing so much musicianship it's hard to imagine they are an unsigned act who have yet to release an album. Their first full length recording is expected next summer.

Filous is French for 'rascal', and Austrian for warm and bright electronic productions. At 19 years-old Matthias Oldofredi is already a sought-after producer, who remixed the likes of Kodaline, José González, Selena Gomez, Milky Chance and Tove Lo. The young man from Vienna is also a self-taught multi-instrumentalist (on mandolin, guitar, piano, accordion, flute, bass and drums) who began uploading remixes in 2014. The following year he released his first original tune, How Hard I Try, featuring James Hersey on vocals. Just as Filous graduated from high school, the track hit over ten million streams and was included on his debut EP Dawn.

This red hot, rocking band from Nijmegen and Amsterdam is back with their trademark sound, which evokes memories of Led Zeppelin and Soundgarden just as much as of Wolfmother, The Black Crowes and Nirvana. Recent years have seen Navarone evolve into one of Europe's strongest rock acts, and their two studio recordings A Darker Shade Of White (2012) and Vim & Vigor (2014) will be followed up this January by third offering Oscillation. It catapults Navarone to a higher level in terms of compositions and production and confirms the outstanding reputation of the group and its  exceptional vocalist Merijn van Haren.

JOHN GRVY is the electronic vehicle of J. E. Edward, a producer from Madrid who doesn't even try to hide his love for music pgenerated by synthesisers. The young man was born in Nigeria and deals in deep electronics, R&B and post-soul. It's a sensual sound, with bittersweet songs like Faded Away and Bad Decisions featuring lyrics about anxiety, as well as sexual and emotional tendencies.

Going from moving rock to dark folk, it's like Norah Jones singing with Madrugada. Soffia Björg has delivered an uplifting and catchy rock single in the form of I Lie, but the Icelandic songstress has so much more up her sleeve. Just listen to seductive downtempo songs like Back & Back Again and you know that her debut album is something to look out for. An act for fans of Angel Olsen, She Keeps Bees and Scout Niblett.

Indie rock singer Johannes Sigmond goes by the name of Blaudzun, a reference to an obscure Danish cyclist. The Dutchman debuted in 2008 with moving folk noir helped by a strong,  melancholic voice. Over the years his sound has matured and he surrounded himself with a more than impressive band. Third album Heavy Flowers was a European breakthrough and Sigmond established himself as one of the most interesting Dutch artists. His recent fifth album features more magic, while the live show is one of the best you'll see during this Eurosonic.

Back to the eighties, to the era of post-punk and new wave: synthesiser dominated but gloomy music venting industrial desperation from Manchester to West Berlin. Drangsal is true to the legacy of The Cure, Spandau Ballet, XTC and Morrissey, but with a more modern indie pop touch. And that eclectic mixture is working for the 23-year-old Berliner Max Gruber. He is storming the German speaking market with his emotional "Brachialpop" (Brute Pop) and furiously dramatic live shows.

Tuareg desert rock from Europe: Kel Assouf from Brussels deliver a wall of sound, grinding guitars, vintage keys and Tuareg rhythms. The band members aim to 'suffocate the sound of war, missiles and rockets' with the most rocking kind of Saharan blues. On the new album Tikounen ('astonishment') Kel Assouf expresses feelings of perplexity and rage towards a world in which war, injustice and pollution are omnipresent.

Dutch label Top Notch starts in January with 'Parels van de Jordaan' ('Pearls of the Amsterdam quarter Jordaan'), a unique musical project focussing on the famous and lesser known names of folk music from the area. Parels van de Jordaan consists of a series of albums of the great names in the history of the Jordaan song: Manke Nelis, Tante Leen, Johnny Meijer, Johnny Jordaan, Louis Davids, Duo de Munk, Alie Roelvink, Zwarte Riek and Willy Albert.

De Nachtdienst is an exciting cocktail of hip hop, jazz and soul, born out of a collaboration between a jazz quintet and MC Claudius de Krentenkoning. Their broken beats, Dutch lyrics and jagged, unconventional arrangements mean that their shows are never predictable, but always energetic, while at the same time creating space for improvisation and poetic reflection. Musically they are inspired by acts like Robert Glasper, Hiatus Kaiyote, Kendrick Lamar, MF DOOM and Madlib. They just crowdfunded 8000 euros to fund their recording, so a new album is coming out in 2017.

Just Rock! That's how these four young boys describe their music. No bullshit, just loud, raw and pure. Influenced by Foo Fighters and Thin Lizzy, the members were born in a region north of Groningen which is regularly hit by earthquakes, and so are their shows.

The amount of noise the trio from Leuven, Belgium manages to produce is impressive, as is almost everything about Brutus. With a guitarist and bass player pounding out a mix of post-metal, post-rock and noise, and all of that kept in check by the awesome singing drummer Stefanie. This is colossal, this is brutal, this is Brutus.

Four chaps from the eastern Dutch region of Twente - and one from 'de Achterhoek' with a soft G accent - decided to start a band together. The only things they had at the start was the name: Dokter Watjes. Musically they bounce around  blues in all directions, and they sing in Dutch, plus in a dialect from Twente and a mishmash of both. Their lyrics are about women and other demons, tobacco products, 'peenk'n..., pets, soft porn and more. Finally a band with something to say. Ie mut alleen wa good luuster'n...(you just have to listen very closely)

They were the surprise of last year's Noorderslag and return this year with quite a different form and reputation. After releasing two EPs and earning a formidable live reputation in 2016, the guys from Amsterdam managed to capture their brand of 90s alternative rock and garage on a full length debut. The self-titled album was produced by Stephen Malkmus (of Pavement fame) and released by Excelsior Recordings. Now the storm that is sweeping through the Netherlands is called Canshaker Pi, obstinate, in full force and merciless.

Money & The Man is a two-man garage-blues band from Zwolle, The Netherlands. Formed in 2013 and Influenced by blues, indie and rock 'n' roll, the guys like to play loud and intense. They have played well over one hundred shows to date,  and released their first EP The World Is Burning in November 2016.

Teaching yourself to play guitar at age 14 by learning to play Radiohead's OK Computer is not a bad start for any musician. But growing up in the middle of Norway Koen van de Wardt didn't have much choice. At college he did, but yearning for the lonely creative days, he created Klangstof and uploaded Hostage to Soundcloud. The emotionally charged single was picked up by a label from LA and Klangstof set out to write about the unfamiliar. Epic soundscapes and guitars recall the quiet and fascinating Scandinavian landscape, while synthesisers and drum-machines add an industrial feel.

With his strong lyrics, gritty voice and catchy melodies Dutch singer-songwriter Hans Hannemann translates American roots music to an entirely unique style. Inspired by legends such as Kris Kristofferson and Elvis and backed by a great band Hans brings classic songwriting back to the stage in 2017.

The Kik is a Dutch beat band inspired by sixties icons like The Beatles and The Kinks. The group is a gathering of former members of The Madd, Mark & The Spies and The Spades. The wayward dry, humorous frontman Dave von Raven is flanked by Arjan Spies (vocals/guitar), Paul Zoontjens (keys), Marcel Groenewegen (bass) and drummer Ries Doms. Their new album should arrive just in time for Noorderslag.

Multi-instrumentalist, composer and songwriter Buslav is a genuine breath of fresh air from Poland. Describing himself as 'wind-catcher, dream-chaser, truth-seeker and songwriter' his project tells a story of emotions, human interest and experience, all encompassed in sound. Following years of international experience as a session musician (in the Cheryl Pepsii Riley house band at Village Underground in New York a.o.) Buslav released his first solo album with Warner Music in Poland in October 2016.

Brian Deady has been something of a well kept secret for the last year or so, but if there's any justice in this world, his single Clap Both My Hands should set all of that straight by making his star rise. With deep blues and gospel influences, at times the Irishman sounds more like he was raised in the Deep South than as one of 10 kids in Cork. His rich, soulful voice comes with a contemporary R&B edge.

Two of Ukraineʼs most fashionable and culturally relevant performers founded Onuka in 2013: Eugene Filatov and Nata Zhizhchenko. On stage their group expands to seven musicians and many varied tools: antique wooden flutes (sopilki), a Ukrainian lute (bandura), trombones, drums, and keyboards. Everything is then filtered through cutting-edge technology.

The term Onuka means "granddaughter" in Ukrainian and pays directs immediate homage to Nataʼs grandfather, Oleksandr Shlionchyk. A recognized master craftsman, his skills are now evident in the stagecraft of a future generation. Nataʼs grandfather, in fact, was held in such regard that he restored a mandolin (or kobza) belong to Ukraineʼs national poet, Taras Shevchenko (1814-1861). It was important to keep memory audibly alive - and the same obligation remains today.

Trashy garage pop rascals Lookapony are all about addictive songs with raw, laid back vocals and energetic melodies, a good old rock 'n' roll vibe and a major 'we don't give a fuck' attitude. The Eindhoven foursome have played well over a hundred shows and supported acts such as Cosmonauts, Audacity, Drenge and Parquet Courts. After releasing a single on a Burger Records compilation mixtape in 2015, they are planning to release their debut full-length recording early this year. Ha-Satan is produced by Raven Aartsen (Mozes & The Firstborn) and recorded by Roel Blommers from Pauw.

Outer Edges is not just any album of Groningen drum 'n bass masters Noisia. "It's called Outer Edges because it's us exploring the outer edges of what Noisia, the three of us together, is. It's about the idea that all the songs are little islands that we take to their individual edge. They're all like expeditions to far sides. There's no real concessions - we haven't been super DJ-friendly or radio-friendly at all. We've done no collaborations and hardly any vocals on the album." - Martijn, Nik and Thijs.

They declare themselves as 'too hardcore for the electro kids, too electro for the hardcore kids' and Lucijan Prelog and Pika Golob might have a point. It's Everyone Else from Ljubljana and Leipzig make a hectic mix of electro, hardcore, rock, noise and pop that is certainly not for the faint of heart. They are probably the only synth duo to invoke massive mosh pits. The Slovenian group will release their third album Heaven Is An Empty Room on the Austrian record label Noise Appeal Records.

Copenhagen's M.I.L.K. announced himself last year with the glorious 'If We Want To' - which has since surpassed 400,000 streams on SoundCloud, and received hugely encouraging tips from the likes of The Line Of Best Fit, SPIN, NME, Nowness, Indie Shuffle and Hillydilly. The first internet-single was followed up by 'Following the Sun' and 'U and Me' - which made tastemaker radios pick up and encourages numerous sources in the internet game to call out M.I.L.K. as One To Watch. An intriguing concoction of tropical production, swaying percussion, and sumptuous melodies, M.I.L.K.'s songwriting harks back to the time of 70's legends such as Curtis Mayfield or Shuggie Otis, and most certainly hints at more modern electronic acts such as Jungle, Rhye or Leisure when it comes to production and overall expression. With a stream of sun-infused-funk-pop to come out in 2017, M.I.L.K. is gearing up to invite even more people to join his endless summer.

Donnerwetter plays psychedelic roots music with the menace of punk. The Dutch quartet navigates between danceable film music , the grooving primal urge of garage bands and dark romantic moods. It is clearly not death but life itself snapping at their heels. Always searching for the thrill of the Donnerwetter Dopamine! The intense live shows sound as if Wilco, MGMT, White Denim, The Cramps and Grizzly Bear together climbed on stage and captured Nick Cave as a ravishing front man.
PlatoMania: "Their kaleidoscopic rock hypnotizes, seduces and confuses." VPRO/3voor12: "Front man Rocco sings straight from the heart. You hear it, you feel it, you see it. Ballsy melancholy."

The Happy Mess is an eclectic project from a multi-faceted indie band signed to Sony. On their second album Half Fiction they've set themselves free, reappearing as a more playful and experimental group. They serve emotional songs that go from pop to rock and have their folky and electronic moments. The Portuguese five piece is known for live performances full of energy bringing together the audience and the band in a party atmosphere.

Cheerful to melancholic post-rock from Portugal. First Breath After Coma have just delivered a stunning second album called Drifter, that is much more than post-rock. On Drifter, a poetic dreamworld opens and songs go in an experimental, opera-like and, mostly, folky direction. Add some angelic community singing and indie folk bands like Fleet Foxes and Local Natives spring to mind.

Trupa Trupa are Grzegorz Kwiatkowski, Tomek Pawluczuk, Wojtek Juchniewicz and Rafał Wojczal from Gdansk, Poland. In 2015 the experimental and extremely versatile band was signed by Blue Tapes and X-Ray Records. That resulted in the critically acclaimed Headache album. The Quietus described it as 'always clever, often beautiful, and at times very angry guitar music, song driven, razor-edged no wave rumblings, anguished Bad Seed shanties, sopping wet blue-eyed soul ballads'. They also compared it to Grizzly Bear's masterpiece Yellow House.

Instrumental jazz masters AdHd are a good example of the magic Iceland has to offer. Their music contains elements of folk, (post-)rock and blues and will take you on a rich, diverse trip. They have released five albums (AdHd to AdHd 5), that were all recorded live to reflect the spirit of their live performances. Like their songs, the show is full of dynamics, going from melancholic to cheerful, from soft to loud.

Bearoid is the electronic pop project of singer and producer Dani Belenguer from Barcelona. His love for Jamiroquai, Chet Faker, Daft Punk and Disclosure has driven him to create funky club music flavoured with soul, disco and R&B, A heady mixture that makes his recent single Out Of My Mind such a joy. Bearoid fills dance floors from Primavera Sound and Festival de les Arts to the clubs of Barcelona, Valencia and Madrid.

Indian Askin is one of the biggest surprises in Dutch music in 2016. Coming from the underground as a garage punk outfit, the Amsterdam band scored a huge hit in 2015, played one of the best shows at Eurosonic's Dutch counterpart Noorderslag early in 2016 and cemented their breakthrough year with debut album Sea Of Ethanol and widely praised performances at over 50 festivals. Warner Music was quick to step in and acquire the album, which delivered more excellent singles like Really Wanna Tell You.

This is dreamy and melancholic indie pop from Ghent, Belgium. St. Grandson is the name of the band around singer-songwriter Benjamin Decloedt, a group that plays radio friendly, atmospheric and heartfelt songs. Midnight Swim is a fine example of their trademark and also the single that got them signed to Universal Music Belgium. Now we're waiting for their debut album, which was recorded with producer Stéphane Misseghers (dEUS, Soulwax).

Sailor & I, a metaphor for two wills in one person that are fighting each other, is a Swedish musician with a special voice who makes very emotive dance music. Singer/producer/multi-instrumentalist Alexander Sjödin has gone from his family's piano to picking up a guitar and tackling elements of jazz, rock, classical and punk to big time electronic productions. With releases on Life and Death and Black Butter Records, remixes by Âme, Kidnap Kid and Joris Voorn, Sailer & I has emerged as one of the most promising new artists of recent years. His debut album is expected early this year..

Jata is the solo project of Berlin artist and producer Jacob Vetter. He grew up in Washington D.C on a diet of 90's hip hop and R&B - a love he carried back to Germany, where electronic music was booming. After university, Jacob became a producer with a passion for vintage analogue audio equipment and synthesisers. His debut EP The Bells and first single Don't Feel Like have already clocked more than 1 million streams across Soundcloud, YouTube, Spotify and Apple Music. His debut album is due early 2017.

Gilles and Yoann, the Brussels duo behind goldFFinch, have been inspired by contemporary electronic movements and have worked hard to redefine it in their own way. Their music brings the best of German electronics, the funkiest of the first Detroit techno wave and cutting edge 22nd century production together in one funk-fuelled musical style. With support from the likes of Richie Hawtin, Loefah, Boddika, Jackmaster, 2562 and Midland, the two Belgians are rapidly gaining popularity and credibility.

What is it with Belgian newcomers on the pop scene, that makes them rise so furiously fast? Bazart is the latest example of the 'goud' (gold) that Belgium seems to have plenty of . The five-piece is anything but an average Belgian band. The group, with roots in Gent and Antwerp, has a signature sound that spells community singing, complex melodies en electronic subtleties. Bazart deliver dark indie pop in their native language, wherein influences range from The National to Yeasayer and from (Dutch to Belgian song-welders) Spinvis to Gorky.

Hailing from Groningen, Ortega present some of the finest, deepest Dutch doom. Their second album Sacred States came out in October, delivering crushing blows all over and drenching The Netherlands in darkness. Since 2007, Ortega have been exploring the murky depths of humanity's longing for the horizon. Perilous collisions of doom, sludge and noise that tell tales of abysmal mankind.

At the time of the release of his cult mix tape Leipie Van Het Plein, Donnie was seen as a protégé of the legendary Dutch hiphop crew De Jeugd van Tegenwoordig. His Dutch delivery and ingenious wordplay might have similarities and sure enough De Jeugd producer Bas Bron helped by adding deep electro funk to his sound, but 'Maradonnie' has claimed his own crown and his reputation is rapidly spreading from Amsterdam. His debut album Manneologie was one of the hiphop releases of 2015 and follow-up Loei Ordinair takes his sound one step further.

Linde Schöne is no less than a revelation in the Dutch music scene. She is responsible for what experts call 'the best Dutch spoken R&B in ages'. The singer and composer from Nijmegen is the type to go straight for her goals, so she just walked up to rapper and label boss Jiggy Djé after a show and handed him a demo. He encouraged her to keep at it and finally signed her after 40 demos. In the end she made 150 demos, chose six and bundled them on debut EP Liefde van de Vloer, which is out on 22nd Century Beats from producer Boeboe.

It's a long name, but one that fits like a glove. The Jerry Hormone Ego Trip is indeed the solo project of Jerry Hormone, once the guitarist for famed Rotterdam punk rockers The Apers, and a well known writer of children's books. This outfit is a different affair altogether, though. It is a Nederbeat (Dutch beat) rock 'n roll band with the best Dutch lyrics since The Kik. Nice ego trip Jerry! Their debut album Stout! Stout! Stout! (Naughty! Naughty! Naughty!) came out in November on the Excelsior label.

This upcoming Belgian producer has a talent that is described as a fusion of Hudson Mohawke and Dimlite. LTGL from Brussels is an eager newcomer who already appeared on LA's Low End Theory and can count The Gaslamp Killer and J.Rocc as fans. He has EP's out on Tangram Records and Brownswood Recordings and is planning another one and a European tour for 2017.

Novo Amor is the stage name of British artist and producer Ali Lacey, who had significant success since the release of his 2014 EP Woodgate, NY. Welshman Lacey managed to attract global attention with his signature lyrical integrity and ethereal songs which conjure up a sense of nostalgia and heartbreak. He is just the kind of songwriter who could and does pull-off a credible, fragile cover of Guns N' Roses' Welcome To The Jungle.

This is beautiful mellow folk music from Norway. Siv Jakobsen likes listening to Laura Marling and Ane Brun and she likes to fill her songs with unfiltered thoughts and reflections and her secrets. She has supported artists like SOAK, Highasakite and American folk artist Damien Jurado on his UK and Irish tour. After praise from blogs like The Line Of Best Fit and airplay on radio stations BBC 6 Music and XFM radio, Jakobsen recorded her debut album in London with producer Matt Ingram, known for his work with Marling, Florence and the Machine, Lianne La Havas and Jake Bugg.

Belgium has a serious noise punk thing going on and Cocaine Piss is at the forefront. The band from Luik/Liège has been ripping up stages for a few years and has now taken it to the next level with their debut album. The Dancer was recorded with legendary producer Steve Albini in Chicago. And, arguably, this female fronted punk band is the best thing the city has to offer: Simple, fast, effective, aggressive yet loving, and with a maniacal live show that will astound you.

With his strong lyrics, gritty voice and catchy melodies Dutch singer-songwriter Hans Hannemann translates American roots music to an entirely unique style. Inspired by legends such as Kris Kristofferson and Elvis and backed by a great band Hans brings classic songwriting back to the stage in 2017.

Harm Coolen and Merijn Scholte Albers dream up slow-burning, emotive and highly dynamic electronic music, usually with a touch of  danceable drama and some epic melodies. Weval's arrangements are so incredibly catchy and well-crafted that you'd suspect some seasoned veteran of being behind the decks instead of these Amsterdam youngsters. After the excellent Half Age EP on local label Atomnation, highly respected German label Kompakt acknowledged their extraordinary talent and released their first full length LP in mid-2016. Weval appeared at Eurosonic last year, but this time around they will play live at both Eurosonic and Noorderslag.

One of the bright new stars of the fresh wave of soulful electronic pop, Anna Of The North is from Oslo, Norway. From the north indeed, then. Even cooler is the fact that Anna managed her Europe-wide breakthrough all on her own. No label, manager or PR-crew were involved. Anna 'just' wrote a wonderful pop song called Sway, that you can't help falling in love with, and put it on Soundcloud. Remixes by the likes of The Chainsmokers and Felix Cartal have helped of course. She has released several dream pop songs and her new single Us takes her into James Blake territory.

'Meet Silvana Imam, the queer feminist punk rapper who's taking on Sweden's fascists with hip-hop!', she screams intriguingly. Listening to her album Naturkraft (2016) we can understand how she has taken the Scandinavians by storm in the past year. Blending in roots from Syria and Lithuania with fierce hip-hop and Swedish lyrics, Silvana Imam has potential cult hit written all over her.

Thomas Azier is a Dutch singer, musician and maker of electronic pop with a compelling dark melancholic tone. He moved to Berlin aged 19 and released two EPs on his own Hylas Records label which led to a deal with Universal Music France. In 2014, after five years of work, his first studio album Hylas was released, which charted in The Netherlands, France and Belgium. Single Talk To Me is an impressive forerunner of his second record, which is expected in the first half of 2017.

There is a new sound coming from Copenhagen that pushes aside the noise and introduces a beautiful array of alternative pop with classical, folk and electronic influences. Enter IRAH. This Danish trio, consisting of Stine Grøn (vocals that will remind you of Beth Gibbons), Adi Zukanovic (synth) and Oliver Laumann (drums), went to Berlin for inspiration and came back with an hour-long jam that evolved into the stunning single Into Dimensions.

Hailing from Estonia NOËP has taken the Baltic and Scandinavian territories first, before descending on Eurosonic and the rest of Europe. His electro pop is fueled by melancholic pop tunes, beats that seem to fly to the Orient and back and moving, occasionally ragga-esque vocals. An intriguing blend by singer-producer Andres Kõpper from Tallinn. Signed to Sony Sweden, his next move is to release an EP as follow-up to smash hit Move.

WILDES is the brand new solo project of 19-year-old Ella Walker from West London. Since releasing her first track Bare early 2016 on Hometown Records, she has received over 5 million streams, worldwide syncs and support from Spotify, Radio1 and BBC introducing. WILDES recently signed a publishing deal and is planning to release a debut EP soon. Eurosonic will be her much anticipated debut as a live act.

Uplifting indie rock and pop punk from Stavanger: Sløtface serve up a powerful and attitude-laden sound with tunes like Angst. The Norwegian four-piece turns heads with their name and then a bit further with their fearlessness and defiance in fusing pop punk with something new. They were 'Tune Of The Week' on BBC Radio 1, and got further support from key international stations such as 3FM, NRK, Flux FM and Triple J. March will see the release of Sløtface's debut album.

Ghost Of You holds candles for post- and math rock and Radiohead's Kid A album, leading them to an alternative, psychedelic, pop sound, which the band from Brno managed to capture on the 2015 album Glacier And The City. The Czech foursome throw some delicate vocals and melancholic melodies into psychedelic pop with blurry guitars and relentless rhythms.

Baptiste W. (Walker) Hamon operates in the rich tradition of North American folksingers like Townes Van Zandt, Guy Clark, Leonard Cohen and John Prine. The 30-year-old troubadour from Paris went to Nashville in pursuit of his folk roots and recorded his debut album there. L'insouciance was produced by Mark Nevers (Caitlin Rose, Vic Chestnutt, Bonnie Prince Billy) and released early 2016. Hamon sings in both French and English. After playing SXSW in 2015 it is time to conquer Europe, starting at Eurosonic.

At just 19 years old Charlotte Brimner has already experienced some major career boosts. She was invited to SXSW twice and played Scotland's biggest pop festival T In The Park. The second single of her group Be Charlotte went straight into the Spotify Viral Top 50. Machines That Breathe is a catchy indie electro-pop song that has 'hit' and 'great future' written all over it. Keep an eye on this talented Scottish multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter, who has been dubbed "The most exciting emerging artist in ages" by BBC Radio 1.

Good reggae bands are hard to come by in Europe but The Dubbeez are holding a strong deck of cards. The group from Amsterdam,convincingly reboots classic roots reggae and club reggae to the year 2017. With the tight rhythm machine formed by Earl on drums and his sister Olivia on bass, the Dubbeez lay a solid foundation for their own, shimmering compositions. The Dubbeez' live show is powered by the front line of three vocalists, tested and approved at reggae and pop festivals all over The Netherlands, which also won them the World Reggae Contest at Ostróda Reggae Festival in Poland.

One of the most exciting new offshoots of the Austrian electronic scene, Wandl comes straight from the regional city St. Pölten and is part of the Affine Records family in Vienna. The 20-year-old musician and producer finds inspiration in Flying Lotus, Hudson Mohawke, and Jamie Lidell, pushing boundaries between electronics, hip hop and (German-language) rap music. "Mach Cash und verdoppelt es!"

An unconventional electronic collective from Porto that travels deep into the exploration and experimentation of what a lab full of synthesisers and groove boxes can produce. The Portuguese trio mix tropical rhythms with industrial vocoders, as well as danceable grooves that produce profound hypnotic ambience. After an EP and a debut album they performed regularly in 2016, including festivals like Primavera Sound and SXSW in Texas, and they now feel completely at home on stage.

Yung Nnelg is one of the most promising hip hop artists from Amsterdam. Having made a name for himself as a member of the SMIB collective as well as on mix tapes by contemporaries like Bokoesam, Nnelg got selected as Encore Freshmen by leading Dutch hip-hop organisation Encore. He scored an internet hit with Chamos and followed up in 2016 with the solid Fox P2 EP.

"Party!" Ever since the release of his first EP in 2009 the life of Groningen rapper Kraantje Pappie has been all about that slogan. The general public got to know him through debut album Crane (2012). His razor-sharp flow and funny lyrics are a golden combination with the fat and heavy productions of fellow Groningen heroes Nightwatch (Noisia, which leads to fierce live shows. Since his breakthrough he plays some 200 shows per year, from the bigger venues to festivals like Rock Werchter, Tomorrowland and Pinkpop.

A celebration of grief, they call it. In any case Crying Boys Cafe is a remarkable band. This four-piece from Rotterdam combines musical happiness with an appreciation of the fragility of life. A bit like the gospel songs in the cotton fields, their songs are cheerful regardless of the situation of the singers. And Crying Boys Cafe present some old fashioned prisoner blues and exotic eighties pop with an indie twist. Their concert will be a ritual of mixed emotions, that much is sure.

Orange Skyline's rapid ascend in the Dutch industry is one out of the books. Performing over 40 festivals in one year such as Concert at Sea and Eurosonic/Noorderslag. Supporting Kensington at sold out Ziggo Dome shows. Having high rotation on 3FM radio, De Wereld Draait Door and being nominated for an Edison award is all quite an achievement if you know that Orange Skyline's debutalbum has yet to be released.
'Things That I Hide' will be released on January 13th and is co-produced by Kraak & Smaak's Oscar de Jong. Their first single 'Sound & Fury' is a good tastemaker of things to come for this Groningen based indie-pop band.

Kevin begon met het schrijven van zijn eerste rapteksten in zijn lokale buurthuis. Zijn talent werd al snel opgemerkt door twee van de oprichters van Rotterdam Airlines. Onder de vleugels van Rotterdam Airlines bleef Kevin zich verder ontwikkelen en bracht meer nummers uit. In 2016 zet de rapper zichzelf op de kaart met zijn debuut single 'Op de block' Ft. Emms van Broederliefde. Ook heeft hij in december, later dat jaar zijn debuut EP 'Kleine Versnelling' uitgebracht. Na een dag stonden alle 9 nummers in de Spotify top 50 van Nederland en het project komt binnen op nummer 3 in de album top 100. Wacht maar tot Kevin een iets grotere versnelling maakt.

Pop punk has managed to hold the mainstream's attention since Green Day turned boredom and punk into chart-topping music in 1994. There is a lot more to the genre of course and Call It Off is glad to prove that point. At the same time the band from Eindhoven is proud of the heritage popularised by bands like Alkaline Trio, Blink-182, Sum 41 and many more. The Dutch four-piece is true to energetic, catchy, three-chord punk pop and serves it up with hook-laden songs and an energising live show.

FATA BOOM is the unborn hip hop love baby of two Dutch artists who found each other during the 3FM Awards of 2016. They secretly met up for some writing sessions and thought their tracks would never even leave their underground studio. Finally they decided to release them, because: "If there's too much shit in your garbage bin, you can't keep the lid shut." FATA BOOM is a grungy hip hop act influenced by M.I.A., Die Antwoord, Missy Elliot, and Grimes that has no intention of being anything but honest about the world we live in.

Short and fast fuzzy garage and noise rock from Amsterdam who specialise in catchy songs with loud guitars. After an EP in 2014, BARTEK followed up in September 2016 with the excellent Beach EP, led by the unpolished title song. They played a series of adrenaline drenched shows that carry the spirit of FIDLAR, Wavves and Ty Segall and a 'we don't give a fuck' attitude. They plan to release their first album in 2017 and provide Noorderslag with a steaming show, stage diving maniacs and all that stuff.

Rotterdam Airlines is a young, independent hip hop record label, management agency and music publisher. Founded in 2009 by a group of friends with a shared passion who have raised eyebrows from the first release Kifesh by Sevn Alias. The record went Gold and the career of Sevn Alias has exploded. The rapidly growing label also hosts Jairzinho, Lil Saint, Chip Charlez, BKO, Johnny Sellah, FMG, YFG and Kevin. After decades of listening to American and English hip hop, Dutch hip hop is now dominating the charts and festivals and Rotterdam Airlines is at the forefront.

They're young, funny and perky, and definitely an internet sensation. It might seem like three guys having good fun, joking around with 'Yung' hiphop names and singing mainly about drugs, sex and afterparties. But just like the title of their album (Free Wifi), it's spot on. It is what going out and life in general seem to be about for a whole generation of kids who feel like Yung Internet delivers the laid back hiphop soundtrack of their lives.

Stuart Mavis is a young Dutch artist who combines strong popsongs with electronic and psychedelic influences.His music is best described as a cross breed between Kendrick Lamar and The Beatles.He blurs the lines with danceable hooks and dark, ingenious lyrics.He performes his songs with an energetic, six-man formation — and an important supporting role for the trumpet.

'Delicious' is indeed the word for this melange of hip hop, jazz, soul, funk and electronic. Pink Oculus is the alter ego of Amsterdam-based artist and producer Esperanza Denswil. She's a brand new, innovative artist who is ready to break through with her blend of rap, smart melodies and  a hypnotising live act. Throughout Europe Pink Oculus is rapidly gaining an outstanding reputation for her enticing live performance.

An eccentric, wayward artist that doesn't just care about music, but about friends and art as well. Friends like Ryan Hemsworth for example, who released his debut single Naked. And friends to collaborate with like Kochi Boy and Mad Decent signing Liz, who invited Henrik to feature on her new album. The Norwegian producer has done remixes for Zayn Malik, Kelly Clarkson, Diplo, Ryan Hemsworth. He was signed to Mad Decent as well, and will be releasing new music as well as going on his first tour of the US.

When thinking of Portugal, Fado quickly springs to mind and with Gisela João this year's focus country sends us one of the youngest and brightest stars this classic genre has to offer. Her 2013 debut album was certified Platinum and established João as one of the country's major artists, and as a contemporary Fadista that possesses both the authenticity and the youthful energy needed for this emotionally demanding genre. There are plenty of people now saying that the 21st Century successor of the great Amália Rodrigues has been found.

How about the trashy, Danish and somewhat  wilder version of Blood Red Shoes? The Courettes from Aalborg just need a guitar and drums. Yeah, OK, a wild soaring guitar, relentless drumming and some mean rock 'n roll singing. All adding up to riotous garage rock, delivered with energy, speed and humour. Danish drummer Martin Wild. and the explosive Brazilian Flávia Couri on vocals and guitar take you back to the furious fifties and do it in some style.

Main: SWITCH
03:15 - 04:15 Thee J Johanz (NL)
04:15 - 05:00 Strano (NL)
05:00 - 06:00 Mononoid (NL)

Visuals: Liza-Renee

Up: SWITCH
02:30 - 03:15 Former (NL)
03:15 - 04:00 Posij (NL)
04:00 - 04:45 Node B2B Beatstra (NL)
04:45 - 05:30 Nangdo (NL)

How about the trashy, Danish and somewhat  wilder version of Blood Red Shoes? The Courettes from Aalborg just need a guitar and drums. Yeah, OK, a wild soaring guitar, relentless drumming and some mean rock 'n roll singing. All adding up to riotous garage rock, delivered with energy, speed and humour. Danish drummer Martin Wild. and the explosive Brazilian Flávia Couri on vocals and guitar take you back to the furious fifties and do it in some style.

Riding high on megahit 'If I Ask' E-Knock, Tony Konstone and Jessy Rose are making waves that will undoubtedly roll far beyond Eurosonic. The boys from Dublin found each other through their love of skating, music and songwriting. As Hare Squead (pronounced Hair Skwed) they produce a mixture of electronic, hiphop and pop that's filling dance floors with such regularity that Columbia Records moved in swiftly to sign them.

Young alternative pop quintet Giant Rooks have rapidly made an impact on the German indie scene with their 'art pop'. The group from the small town of Hamm are characterised by an atmospherically dense sound and the powerful voice of singer Finn. They have built a large following with only a debut single, the magical Småland, followed in May 2016 by the now sold out EP The Times Are Bursting The Lines, and their fans are now waiting impatiently for an album.

Mairo Nawaz is part of a new DJ-breed of young, talented and up-and-coming artists from Amsterdam. Growing up listening to his mother's reggae and grandmother's soul and jazz music, he started drumming at the age of ten and got into hip-hop and R&B in his teens. He holds three monthly residencies in Amsterdam and Rotterdam and travelled to clubs around the world as a member of the Patta Soundsystem. Together with Vic Crezée, he also hosts a residency at Amsterdam's most promising club De School.

Brass party! Gallowstreet have turned many festival stages around Europa upside down with their hyper-infectious grooving blend of brass, hip hop and trap. It works so well that they now run their own Enter the Gallowstreet night. After an EP and a 7" they've taken a giant leap in 2016 by releasing their debut album Battleplan on V2.

This will be a unique performance as neoclassical composer Jan Swerts presents the album Schaduwland (Shadowland), described as the "neoclassical, desolate soundtrack of a zombified existence after the great catastrophe" that hit him. In 2014 the Belgian artist had to leave his family because of health issues and afterwards his mother died of cancer. All the horror led him to create a captivating third album and a show that will be heard out of Belgium for the first time.

Has neo classical music been on the rise since the death of Dutch master composer Simeon ten Holt? It might have shed more light on a scene where followers of Steve Reich and Philip Glass have always been entertaining audiences. The difference is that in the wake of Ten Holt's passing more and more festivals and crowds have discovered the magic appeal of modern classical music. Amsterdam composer Joep Beving certainly doesn't need that, as his debut album Solipsism undoubtedly shows, but we're glad to see him thrive so much.

Marc Frischknecht - the brains behind YES I'M VERY TIRED NOW - creates dreamy, sketch-like tracks that are feather-light and also feature sudden powerful bursts into dance and dreamscapes. The singer-producer from St. Gallen, Switzerland makes atmospheric, electronic pop 'for day-time dreamers and night-time dancers'. His music has been described as 'no-frills pop in the best sense of the term, with clear, uncluttered songs and one of the best Swiss male voices of the moment'. Frischknecht plans to release a new album in January 2017 and is appearing at Eurosonic with a full band.

What happens when you put an opera singer and a drummer from Sarajevo together? Both happen to be producers, with several releases under their belts, and it's safe to say the whole equals more than the sum of the parts. Think of trip hop, classical and electronic music bumping into each other until one trippy and danceable blend is formed. The duo has been performing and experimenting together for over a decade already.

A Danish-Australian duo that moulds a taste for indie rock in the form of War On Drugs, Kurt Vile, Here We Go Magic, with songwriters like Elliot Smith into a successful sound might seem unlikely. Yet that is what Carl Coleman and Caspar Hesselager have pulled off. The organic songwriting and guitar-strumming of Carl merges with seamlessly with Caspar's skills as a producer and classically-trained pianist turned electronic musician. Several singles from their tasteful 2015 debut EP got noticed and the duo followed up with the excellent Waiting For The World To Turn debut full-length in 2016.

Young British singer-songwriter that has supported Birdy all over Europe and the UK in venues including the Hammersmith Apollo (London), Olympia (Paris) and the Vienna Konzerthaus. Not bad for someone with only two EP's and a handful of singles released. But Dan Owen from Shropshire is the kind of bluesy songwriter that has both slow heart wrenching ballads and more uptempo roots-y stompers up his sleeve.

Every now and then a classical songwriter comes along, plays the field like generations before him and you immediately feel he's got what it takes: the voice, the tunes and the conviction. Young James TW is a songwriter from London signed to Island Records. His debut EP First Impressions generated over 37 million Spotify streams and lead track When You Love Someone charted as #1 on the Shazam charts after the first radio play. He now caters an audience of over 2.5 million monthly listeners with his songs and covers including Gnarls Barkley's Crazy.

Having grown up in Kinshasa and Brussels, Témé Tan manages to fuse his wordly roots with pop, hiphop and electronics. But it is not just African rhythms that fascinate this young Belgian. His travels added inspiration from Japan and Brazil, and the joyously seductive single Améthys is proof of his potential. Early 2017 will see him release his debut album through PIAS International.

Born in Maastricht, raised in Amsterdam, 23-year-old Jarreau Vandal grew up in a musical family surrounded by cassette tapes full of jazz, soul and funk. The 90's allowed him to fully immerse himself in hip-hop, rock and R&B and artists like Jamiroquai, A Tribe Called Quest, Red Hot Chili Peppers. His grandfather introduced him to music production program Logic at 16 and he hasn't stopped producing since. As a member of LA collective Soulection, Jarreau Vandal released a groundbreaking EP in 2014 and bridged more gaps between dance, hip-hop, R&B and jazz on the EP Suburb Superhero (2016).

Timo de Jong is a Dutch musician who writes timeless and unpretentious pop songs, influenced by folk and country music. The songs are about him and his life, but in fact they could apply to anyone, covering topics such as car thieves, cowboys and as-yet unborn daughters. Timo released two albums in 2016 and is capable of making every location he performs in feel like a cosy living room.

The voice, the guitar, the songs; Jakob Kobal comes to Groningen well equipped with influences ranging from Kings of Convenience and Syd Barrett to Ben Howard and Jeff Buckley. The songwriter from Slovenia is attempting to convey his thoughts and his perspective on the world through his lyrics and music. Aiming for spiritual growth and to recreate his state of being at the time he writes a song. His show promises to be an intimate and enchanting happening, and Kobal hopes to releases his debut album late 2016.

Oslo's Kai Gundelach serves up brooding, delicate ear-worms, pulsating electronic beats and a coolly honed falsetto. His modern electronic pop is topped-off by his 70's rock-influenced guitar playing and a voice that recalls artists like How to Dress Well and Chet Faker. He has gone from recording in his bedroom to playing sold out shows in the span of just one year. In 2017 Gundelach plans to release his debut LP and tour Europe extensively.

Declan McKenna's career has been rocketing since the release of the single Brazil in 2014. The young Brit delivers indie pop in politically charged songs and with a bold Libertines-like attitude. After claiming the Emerging Talent prize at Glastonbury 2015 McKenna performed on the Conan O'Brien TV show and toured the USA with his own and other bands. But all this extensive touring has pushed back his debut album, which is due out on Columbia Records February 2018.

Inner Tongue is the latest in a string of excellent, electronic-tinged acts from the Austrian capital Vienna to arrive at Eurosonic. After Elektro Guzzi, Soap&Skin, Cid Rim and SOHN this newcomer is probably the most poppy. And his story the most incredible: the Austrian had to undergo major vocal chord surgery and keep silent for months. He lifted himself out of depression, locked himself in his studio and started to compose songs. The resulting EP Tz, Ka. is a dreamy, hypnotic soundscape like trip, performed live with a 5-piece band.

The rawest and freshest hip-hop from the streets of South London. 67 (or 6ix7even) don't care about Google rankings, but LD, Dimzy, ASAP, Monkey, SJ and Liquez pack more punches than a kangaroo on speed. And they are on fire, 2016 mix tapes, Let's Lurk and In Skengs We Trust, will erase any doubt as to who is running the game.

Electronic and psychedelic pop from Switzerland made by Cedric Streuli, a.k.a. Buvette. He has just released his fourth album Elasticity via Pan European Recording and it's full of magical pop with unexpected twists, electro beats, robotic singing and heavy synths that bring some heart-warming 80s nostalgia to Eurosonic.

Gidge is Jonatan Nilsson and Ludvig Stolterman from Umeå, in the north of Sweden. The classmates had a mutual interest in electronic music, took a Sound Production class and started producing music. Nine years later, they released debut LP Autumn Bells through Dutch label Atomnation. The goal was an electronic album made from natural sounds and moods. Using the woods and the vastness of the north as their main inspiration, they mixed warm electronics, melancholic vocal samples and recordings from the forest into an emotional LP. They were voted Best New Artist in XLR8R's readers poll of 2014.

Young, wild and happening; Dead! is four guys from Southampton who formed a band in 2012, made a lot of noise, moved to London, and made more noise. Influenced by bands like Placebo, Smashing Pumpkins and Brand New, Dead! make alternative rock in a very DIY punky fashion. Their 2014 EP Tu Me Manques was recorded by Dan Weller (Enter Shikari, Fearless Vampire Killers, Young Guns) and lead single Phantom generated lots of press and airplay from BBC Radio 1 (Zane Lowe). Follow-up track Skin delivered the goods again, also being named Kerrang! Radio's Track Of The Week.

Their sound is raw, sleazy, psychedelic and has the riotous nature that you know will drive your evening into the next gear of savageness. They're called Shame, they originate in Brixton, South London, and their music can be described as a mixture of Happy Mondays, The Doors, Sleaford Mods, Sex Pistols and Slaves. Yes it's punk, yes it's danceable and you can rest assured that it's brimming with youthful wild energy.

Their sound is raw, sleazy, psychedelic and has the riotous nature that you know will drive your evening into the next gear of savageness. They're called Shame, they originate in Brixton, South London, and their music can be described as a mixture of Happy Mondays, The Doors, Sleaford Mods, Sex Pistols and Slaves. Yes it's punk, yes it's danceable and you can rest assured that it's brimming with youthful wild energy.

It is safe to say that Roosevelt will be one of the must-see electronic acts at Eurosonic. German artist Marius Lauber was already tipped as having a great future when he played there in 2013. After an EP and many festival shows he started on his debut album. It paid off: the self titled release of August 2016 was immediately heralded as an electro pop masterpiece. Flirting with disco, chill wave, Ibiza house, yacht rock, 80s new wave and modern figureheads Floating Points and Todd Terje, Roosevelt has gained over a million monthly Spotify listeners and a lot more bookings.

Talk about making an immediate mark upon arrival! Iceland's newest pop sensation Glowie has stormed the charts with four hit singles in a row. The then 18-year-old Sara Pétursdóttir released her debut single No More early in 2015 and went straight to number 1 in the official Icelandic chart. The same thing happened with her most recent effort No Lie. Her secret? The part time model delivers golden pop tunes with a dance beat and sensuous vocals.

Flavien Berger is not your average producer. The 28-year-old self-taught musician creates sentimental stories through wordplay and has always been interested in testing swirling sounds, fiddling with engines and making unusual musical hybrids. Berger appeared as a breath of fresh air on the French scene, and specialises in music with aquatic influences, best example is his first album Leviathan, which came out in 2015 on Parisian label Pan European Recordings. The Frenchman supported Christine and The Queens on her arena tour in the third quarter of 2015.

Gardien de la paix, meaning guardians of peace is how Salut C'est Cool present themselves and their folky techno - techno dada as they call it - might just deliver on that. It's definitely music to party and celebrate life to. The idea of the French group is to bring a new cool wave to music, and to do it with joy and energy. This performance will definitely bring smiles all around.

Soothing and catchy indie pop from Belfast, Northern Ireland. Daniel Todd and James Smith are exmagician, a duo whose debut album recalls the compelling powers of The Shins and the genius of Eels and Beck. It was released early 2015 by Bella Union after which exmagician toured the UK and Ireland. The two songwriter-producers are influenced by Captain Beefheart, The Fall, Pavement and Super Furry Animals. And now they have their eyes firmly set on the horizon: first Germany, after that Eurosonic, and then Europe.

Alternative/noiserock trio from the East of the Netherlands are a band that doesn't care about lists, bank accounts or what is supposedly hip. Paceshifters resurrect the alternative rock of the 90s and they just finished several sold out Nevermind tribute shows. The band is like a bolt of lightning for the current musical landscape, channelling an unbridled ambition and energy, and seeing them live is believing. Their new album, recorded with producer Chris 'Frenchie' Smith (o.a. Datsuns, Dandy Warhols), will come out in March of this year.

Otzeki is two cousins whose mutual appreciation for David Beckham and Ricardo Villalobos led them to make music together. Already likened to Animal Collective, The xx and Local Natives, it's easy to see why the duo are drawing such esteemed comparisons with subtle but powerful vocals deftly merging with electronic undertones. They are already making a name for themselves with their live sets, having recently supported Real Lies as well as Lust For Youth in London clubs.

Her Live Tape #1 is dripping with pure soul, funk and R&B. It's by HER; two French guys that 'represent all the women who inspired them and also the incarnation of duality'. A childhood listening to Kraftwerk and Can in Germany meets an exile from the United States imprinted with the roots of black music. It shapes their songs, best described as Frank Ocean meets Shuggie Otis, Child of Lov meets Aaron Neville. HER is signed to Universal/Barclay in France, Island in the UK and Republic in the US, and their full length debut is expected to drop this year.

Shoegaze, dream pop and heartbreaking alternative rock, this new Belgian band is playing a field that stretches from veterans Slowdive and My Bloody Valentine to US newcomers Nothing. On their debut album Space, Newmoon create a kaleidoscopic swirl of sound, an abstract world of textures, post-punk mood shifts and aural tsunamis crashing on the distant silver shores of the imagination. The group from Ghent is on a European tour that will lead them to Groningen.

Tom Hades [be]

Belgian waffles. Belgian chocolate. Tom Hades. Some things don't need much of an explanation. Such is the case with the Belgian Techno maestro, whose career is moving him towards legendary status. Covering all flavours within the techno and tech house genres with his productions released on respected labels such as Adam Beyer's Drumcode, John Digweed's Bedrock, Umek's 1605, and long-time collaborator Marco Bailey's MB Elektronics, it's obvious that Tom Hades can tackle all dimensions of the sound with unparalleled ease.
Never one to shy away from globetrotting, Tom Hades DJ-ing and live shows have taken him around the world a multitude of times. From Fabric in London to Fabrik in Madrid, and from Awakenings to I Love Techno, his work ethic demonstrates a literal tour de force.

Roy El Kei [nl]

Roy El Kei has without a doubt established himself as one of Holland's most prominent rising stars within the techno scene. His music reflects his attention to detail in the studio. It therefore comes as no surprise that he is signed to respected labels such as Bush Records, Rhythm Converted, Recode Musik Records and Marco Bailey's MB Elektronics.
He recently toured throughout Asia and Australia. In The Netherlands he performs at popular venues including Studio 80, Westerunie, Factory 10 and major events such as "I Am Techno", Wildness Festival, Solar Festival, Chateau Techno and Kingsland. Roy El Kei has become a permanent fixture in the global touring techno elite.

The Norwegian avant-garde pop prince Nils Bech is renowned for his other-worldly vocals, his combination of classical arrangements and traditional popular song structures, and his highly conceptual live performances at The 54th Venice Biennale and the Roskilde Festival among others. He was signed to the American label DFA Records, who released his album Echo worldwide in October 2016.

You can't take the Congo out of a Congolese living in Belgium and that's definitely something to be thankful for. Just listen to Baloji. He stands at the crossroads of African music, rap, the French singer-songwriter tradition, electronic music (trance, deep house) and Afro-American music (soul, funk, jazz), which he discovered through hip hop culture and sampling. His next album is will arrive early this year.

Mikko Joensuu is a singer-songwriter who stands out from the crowd. His first albums Amen 1 & 2 tap into the American folk music tradition and classic songwriters like Townes Van Zandt, Lee Hazlewood and Leonard Cohen. His sound is all about deep, healing songs that can give the impression of spending time in quiet, intimate surroundings. The arrangements are raw but beautiful, mostly just piano and guitar accompany the Finnish musician's voice, with occasional pedal steel guitars and soothing string sections. Part 3 of the trilogy comes out in the spring.

Psychedelic and space rock trio Mother's Cake transmit a raw and pure energy that affects people on a primal and collective level. They have supported artists like Iggy Pop, Deftones, John Garcia, Limp Bizkit and the Omar Rodriguez Lopez Group. Blending in some funk, jazz and unexpected twists like the love baby of The Mars Volta and the Chili Peppers, the Austrians are gearing up for their third album arriving in January this year.

Glints is the brainchild of J.M. Lemmens and was born out of a love for language, luscious sentences, and heart-felt music. Growing up in Belgium (Antwerp) with a British background proved to be a fertile breeding ground for a sound that combines elements of hip hop, electronic music and pop. The project sets out to titillate the senses whilst re-establishing the importance of poetry in lyrics. Lemmens was named artist to watch in 2015 by Red Bull and in 2016 by Noisey. His second EP will be released through PIAS.

Electronic duo CUT_ took off rapidly after their rendition of Stromae's Papaoutai went viral. They have since played numerous shows, including performances at the Amsterdam Dance Event and most of the major Dutch festivals. After retreating to the French Alps to work on new material and signing a record deal with [PIAS], the Amsterdam group released the single Tune In Tune Out. Their music is a cross-over between dark alternative electronics and edgy pop music, inspired by acts such as Flume, AlunaGeorge and Jamie xx.

DJ Firmeza brings to the tables a blend of styles like kuduro, batida and Afro house, usually quite uptempo, rhythmically complex and insanely energetic. His music is firmly rooted in Lisbon's Afro-Portuguese club music scene and has been steadily gaining momentum thanks to label Príncipe and a Resident Advisor feature predicting a great future for 20-year-old Firmeza. He released Alma Do Meu Pai, his first record and a tribute to his late father, in October 2015 on Príncipe.

Steaming jazz with hip-hop beats led by Belgian saxophonist Robin Verheyen, delivered with a maximum of energy and sensitivity and spiced with a punk approach and the haunting lyrics of dEUS frontman Tom Barman. Yes, you might say TaxiWars from Antwerp are a typical Belgian band, hard to pin down, high on experimentation and creativity. So it's only a matter of time before they show up at Eurosonic.

They aim for the big stages and are not afraid of big feelings either. Farewell Dear Ghost make great guitar-driven pop music that's got an overwhelming stadium-size feel to it. They hail from Vienna, Austria and are clearly influenced by artists like Coldplay, The National and The Naked And Famous. Memories and impressions from a tour through China were condensed into their latest offering, the EP Skin, which leads the band directly towards the release of a new album in 2017.

Olde Gods is the joint venture of Guillamino (Bankrobber, Third Ear, ICAN, RBMA) and JMII (100% Silk, Hivern Discs), whose tracks have gotten support by acts like John Talabot, Simian Mobile Disco and Jennifer Cardini. The duo from Barcelona debuted on their own label Minor Planets with a vinyl trilogy and the next single None Of These Bitches (in Daikanyama) was released via Atomnation. The Dutch label will also release their EP early this year.

Jacques is a different story altogether. His haircut is obviously not inspired by Keith Flint (Prodigy). Actually he chose it to become more self-confident, as he explained during his TED Talk. The 'Anti-Hipster' haircut is supposed to force him to avoid boring jobs, to sleep with very open-minded girls and to focus on his music: Inspired by Berlin techno as well as French electronics, his music is a journey to discover the beauty present in each sound we hear. Everything from the rain to a cat eating can be a source of inspiration for what Jacques calls 'Transversal Techno'.

Tipped as 'one of the most exciting outfits on the live circuit' by Drowned in Sound, and the high energy rock 'n roll on their last singles and EP Don't You Wanna seems to support that. The Amazons are a four-piece rock band from Reading, UK. Signed to Fiction Records in 2015, they have received fervent support from Radio 1's Huw Stephens and Annie Mac. The Amazons head into 2017 off the back of a sold out headline tour and a debut album set for the spring.

Beissoul & Einius come from Vilnius with a serious reputation, the duo being already pretty famous in the Baltic States and Ukraine for their soulful dance performances. Beissoul ("bass soul" in phonetic Lithuanian) possesses a soulful voice that is uncommon in the eastern parts of Europe. The artist with Ukrainian roots has studied pantomime which enables him to deliver impressive dance moves on stage, usually in iconic costumes and headgear. Influences range from Moby and Burial to Spice Girls.

Maarten Devoldere, one of two strong voices from the famed Belgian pop band Balthazar, is rapidly making his own mark. As Warhaus he delivers more melancholic pop, intriguingly tainted with his distinct hoarse vocals. His debut solo album We Fucked A Flame Into Being has produced four singles already and is a prime example of his songwriting prowess. With his reflective lyrics, sober instrumentation and sensuous female vocals, Devoldere creates a dark, tense atmosphere reminiscent of the likes of Tom Waits, Leonard Cohen, Serge Gainsbourg and Nick Cave.

On her second album, Je Doet Je Best Maar, composer and singer-songwriter Aafke Romeijn discovered the world of analogue synthesizers and other antique instruments. Using a retro-sound she wrote songs about bad politicians and car salesmen, about secretly wanting to be a boy and filling in endless forms. Romeijn's warm electronic pop is accompanied by wry and clever lyrics that are full of familiar everyday situations. In Autumn 2016 she released the new EP Anders Nog Iets, spearheaded by successful single Alles Went with rapper Sef.

Irish folk pop with great hit potential, based around lead singer-songwriter Patrick Sheehy. Walking On Cars is a five-piece from  Southwestern County Kerry that deals in passionate, folk-influenced pop. The group won the Red Bull Bedroom Jam Competition in 2012, getting airplay for their first singles. In January 2016 the Irishmen released their debut album on Virgin/EMI. Everything This Way is full of piano-driven rock with grand sing alongs in the tradition of Snow Patrol and Coldplay. EBBA Award-winning single Speeding Cars is a prime example.

Noiserv is the solo project of David Santos from Lisboa, an artist who is rapidly and firmly establishing himself in France and Germany. Think of poetic and ethereal, neo-classical songs that draw references to Yann Tiersen, Sigur Rós or Radiohead. Santos prefers to do everything himself: writing songs, making videos, recording, releasing and performing. A admirable, Prince-like level of self-sufficiency that has certainly already taken him very far.

Amsterdam-born Celine Cairo became a singer-songwriter one week after finishing university, choosing to pursue music, and has since released two EP's, collaborated with FINK and played  numerous shows in The Netherlands and abroad. Celine's next step will be the release of her debut album, which was recorded in Los Angeles with her backing band. It features melancholic and electronic soundscapes, wrapped around enchanting pop songs.

salute is a product of the rich and versatile Viennese electronics and jazz scene. The now 20-year-old producer was already being named as one the main talents when Austria was focus country of Eurosonic 2014. He has since moved to Brighton and integrates UK bass, US hiphop and trap in a unique and streetwise blend. Try the recent EP My Heart for a showcase of his talent. Live, salute is an orchestral and bass heavy threesome that is equally unmissable.

Norwegian power-unit Sauropod are about to conquer Europe with their highly energetic stew of garage, post-grunge, punk and indie rock. The trio from Oslo released debut album Roaring at the Storm in September last year. The record was produced by Hasse Rosbach (Turbonegro, Team Me) and was followed by a headline tour in November and December. Singles Winter Song and Headphones received international praise from the likes of Clash Magazine, The Line Of Best Fit and Drowned in Sound.

Brighton five-piece Fickle Friends have been cutting their teeth the old fashioned way, with two years of solid touring, including sets at major festivals such as Bestival, BBC R1 Big Weekend and The Secret Garden Party, not to mention six sold out London shows. Away from the stage the indie pop band was the most blogged-about unsigned artist of 2014 according to Hype Machine, and they picked up over seven million plays on Spotify across their debut singles.

Blackbriar is a five-piece alternative metal band with a special twist in the form of a mysterious singer, capable of opening the gates of both heaven and hell with her voice. A powerful drummer, bad-ass bass player and two highly technically-proficient guitar players form the backbone of Blackbriar. They come from the city of Assen (NL) and are about to release their crowdfunded debut EP.

Indie pop from Leipzig in the former DDR, White Wine are Joe Haege (31knots, Tu Fawning, Menomena, Dodos), Fritz Brückner (Blut Sport Disko) and Chistian "Kirmes" Kühr (Zentral Heizung Of Death) having fun playing a sort of crazy retro-futuristic indie madness. They released their debut record on This Charming Man Records last March and have a new record coming out early 2017.
